original: du ma la yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par yongs su ma bzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: du ma la yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par yongs su ma bzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Also means “even though there are many.”

original: de yang 'di cig car blangs pa la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di cig car blangs pa la shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood as referring to the case of taking up the precepts all at once.

original: gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be stated:

original: mthar gyis ni dang po'i zhes bya ba ni blangs pa dang ldan ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthar gyis ni dang po'i zhes bya ba ni blangs pa dang ldan ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “In the case of gradual taking up, it is the first that is possessed.”

original: gang zhig dang por blangs pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig dang por blangs pa de la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it is the first that is taken up.

original: gang du yongs su 'dzin pa po med pa nyid de tsam la brten nas /
analyzed: gang du yongs su 'dzin pa po med pa nyid de tsam la brten nas /
translated: In the case of the absence of a holder, to that extent,🔽without making any distinction with regard to any person, it is as if it were said, “Take what is to be taken,” and it is abandoned.

original: gang zag gang la yang bye brag tu ma byas par su khyer ba khyer cig snyam du bor bar gyur na de la su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gang la yang bye brag tu ma byas par su khyer ba khyer cig snyam du bor bar gyur na de la su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to that, who is the owner?

original: de'i phyir med pa nyid yin zhing ma bsngos par bor na song ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa nyid yin zhing ma bsngos par bor na song ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is as if it were nonexistent, and it is taken up as if it were abandoned without dedication.”

original: de ni mthar gyis dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni mthar gyis dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like the case of gradual taking up.

original: ji ltar mthar gyis slong ba dang bor gang gis blangs pa dbang ba dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar mthar gyis slong ba dang bor gang gis blangs pa dbang ba dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is as if it were owned by the one who first took it up.🔽If the debtor dies, the property of the deceased is owned by the creditor to the extent of the amount of the debt.

original: bu lon pa byung na de la gzhal bar bya ba'i tshad kyi shi ba'i yo byad de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la de la gzhal bar bya pa'i tshad kyi zhes bya ba @129b ni ;
analyzed: bu lon pa byung na de la gzhal bar bya ba'i tshad kyi shi ba'i yo byad de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la de la gzhal bar bya pa'i tshad kyi zhes bya ba @129b ni ;
translated: The meaning of “to the extent of the amount of the debt” is

original: gang zhig bu lon pa de shi ba des gzhal bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi tshad kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig bu lon pa de shi ba des gzhal bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi tshad kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the property of the deceased debtor to the extent of the amount of the debt.

original: de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bu lon ba nyid dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bu lon ba nyid dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of “is owned by the creditor” is that the debtor is owned by the creditor.

original: ma bgos par byung na de la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis de gzhal bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ma bgos par byung na de la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis de gzhal bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If the debtor dies without having repaid the debt, the property of the deceased is to be used to repay the debt.🔽If the debtor dies after having repaid the debt, the property of the deceased is not to be used to repay the debt.

original: bgos pa'i 'og tu byung na ni de la mi gzhal bar bya ba nyid do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bgos pa'i 'og tu byung na ni de la mi gzhal bar bya ba nyid do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To remove this doubt, the root text states, “Even if the debt has been repaid.”

original: gzhal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The object of evaluation is to be evaluated.

original: de dang lhan cig rnam par gzhag pa de la sbyin bar bya ba nyid dam blang bar bya ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig rnam par gzhag pa de la sbyin bar bya ba nyid dam blang bar bya ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is to be given or taken in regard to that which is established together with that is the object of evaluation.🔽That is not the case here.

original: de nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shi ba de dang bu lon ded pa dang / bu lon 'jal bar lhan cig gang zhig gnas pa de la 'dir dge slong rnams kyis gzhal bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shi ba de dang bu lon ded pa dang / bu lon 'jal bar lhan cig gang zhig gnas pa de la 'dir dge slong rnams kyis gzhal bar bya ba 'am /
translated: The monks should evaluate or take that which is to be evaluated or taken in regard to the dead person and the debtor and creditor who remain together.

original: bslang bar bya ba nyid de de nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bslang bar bya ba nyid de de nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: That is not the case in regard to the dead person alone.

original: gang zhig des bu lon pa'i drung nas blangs pa de bu lon chags pa la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig des bu lon pa'i drung nas blangs pa de bu lon chags pa la sbyin pa'o //
translated: That which is taken from the debtor by the creditor is given to the debtor.

original: k'arsh'a pa na rnams dbul bar bya'o zhes bya bas k'arsh'a pa na rnams bzung ba de rnams nyid gzhal bar bya'o //
analyzed: k'arsh'a pa na rnams dbul bar bya'o zhes bya bas k'arsh'a pa na rnams bzung ba de rnams nyid gzhal bar bya'o //
translated: The karṣāpaṇas should be paid. The karṣāpaṇas that are mentioned should be evaluated.

original: ras yug chen blangs te rin sbyin bar bya'o zhes bya'o zhes 'thams pa la ni rin sbyin par bya'i ras yug chen dngos sbyin par mi bya ba dang / tha ga pa la ras yug chen gyi don du rgyu spun gtad pa la sa ni ras yug chen blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: ras yug chen blangs te rin sbyin bar bya'o zhes bya'o zhes 'thams pa la ni rin sbyin par bya'i ras yug chen dngos sbyin par mi bya ba dang / tha ga pa la ras yug chen gyi don du rgyu spun gtad pa la sa ni ras yug chen blang bar bya'i /
translated: The monk should say, I will give the price for the woolen cloth, and he should give the price, but he should not give the woolen cloth.

original: rgyu spun blang bar mi bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu spun blang bar mi bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The weaver should say, I will take the woolen cloth, and he should take the woolen cloth, but he should not take the thread.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis phra ba bslangs pa dang / de na re 'phags pa dag bdag gis de la sbom po dbul bar bgyi ba lags so zhes zer nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis phra ba bslangs pa dang / de na re 'phags pa dag bdag gis de la sbom po dbul bar bgyi ba lags so zhes zer nas /
translated: A monk asked for thread, and the weaver said, Noble one, I will give you cloth in exchange for the thread.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽The monk should take the cloth in exchange for the thread, just as if the monk were dead.

original: de dag dge slong shi ba ci 'dra ba gtad ba de 'dra ba bslang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de ni tha snyad kyi cho gas nges par de blang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag dge slong shi ba ci 'dra ba gtad ba de 'dra ba bslang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de ni tha snyad kyi cho gas nges par de blang ba ma yin no //
translated: This is not a definite taking of it by the conventional rite.

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'bad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'bad par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not strive in this.

original: de ni 'bad pa'i gnas ma yin no snyam pa de la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bad pa'i gnas ma yin no snyam pa de la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught for one who thinks, This is not a basis for striving.

original: gal te tha snyad tsam slob pa de'i phyir 'dir mdor byas so //🔽de tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bu lon chags pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shi ba la bu lon chags pa des /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad tsam slob pa de'i phyir 'dir mdor byas so // de tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bu lon chags pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shi ba la bu lon chags pa des /
translated: If it is only for the sake of conventional knowledge, then this is a summary here.🔽He does not become indebted to his fellow brahmacarins.

original: de'i don las ma dag pa byas par 'di la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis gzhal bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i don las ma dag pa byas par 'di la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis gzhal bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that his fellow brahmacarins do not consider him to be impure in his actions for their sake, because he is indebted to the dead person.

original: lag gi blas dkon mchog gi blangs ba nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir ji snyed pa de snyed pa de snyed mnyam par bsab po zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: lag gi blas dkon mchog gi blangs ba nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir ji snyed pa de snyed pa de snyed mnyam par bsab po zhes bya ba na /
translated: If it is said that he takes the property of the Three Jewels, then for that reason it is said that he should make restitution to the extent of his ability.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog rnams kyi dkor ni dkon mchog gi'o //🔽de blangs pa @130a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog rnams kyi dkor ni dkon mchog gi'o // de blangs pa @130a * //
translated: The property of the Three Jewels such as the Buddha is the property of the Three Jewels.

original: ni 'dis bzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni 'dis bzung ba ste /
translated: Taking that is taking it from them.

original: de bas na dkon mchog gi blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na dkon mchog gi blangs pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is taking the property of the Three Jewels.

original: de'i dngos po ni de snyed mnyam par bsab par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de snyed mnyam par bsab par bya'o //
translated: The state of that is making restitution to the extent of one's ability.

original: de'i ji snyed pa las zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gi ji snyed pa las de dang 'brel ba blangs pa nyid ni mnyam par bsab ste /
analyzed: de'i ji snyed pa las zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gi ji snyed pa las de dang 'brel ba blangs pa nyid ni mnyam par bsab ste /
translated: The phrase “from that which is the extent of the Three Jewels” means that the extent of the Three Jewels is related to that which is taken up.

original: de snyed pa'i dkon mchog la cha mnyam par bya ste mnyam par bsab par bya ste /
analyzed: de snyed pa'i dkon mchog la cha mnyam par bya ste mnyam par bsab par bya ste /
translated: The extent of the Three Jewels is equal, and thus it is said that “the extent of the Three Jewels is equal.”

original: 'on kyang gal te tha dad par byed pa de dge 'dun gyi ni mchod rten gyir byed /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te tha dad par byed pa de dge 'dun gyi ni mchod rten gyir byed /
translated: However, if one makes a distinction, then the property of the Saṅgha is made the property of the caitya,🔽and the property of the caitya is made the property of the Saṅgha.

original: mchod rten gyi ni dge 'dun gyir byed de de bzhin du chos kyi yang 'dres par byed na lhung bzed dang chos gos las cha gsum du byas te zhes bya ba gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi ni dge 'dun gyir byed de de bzhin du chos kyi yang 'dres par byed na lhung bzed dang chos gos las cha gsum du byas te zhes bya ba gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If one mixes up the property of the Three Jewels in this way, then one should divide the property of the Three Jewels into three parts, and then divide one’s own share into three parts.

original: 'on kyang bden mod kyi de ltar 'dis dkon mchog gi blangs par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bden mod kyi de ltar 'dis dkon mchog gi blangs par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: However, this is true, but in this way, one does not take up the property of the Three Jewels.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi 'dod pa byas pas gzhan dang 'brel ba la gzhan dag la ster ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi 'dod pa byas pas gzhan dang 'brel ba la gzhan dag la ster ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because one does not give to others what is related to others by doing what one wants.

original: de ni sbyin bdag tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni sbyin bdag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not become the owner of the gift.

original: mnyam par bsab pa nyid 'di shes par byed pa la de nyid 'di'i dgongs pas rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par bsab pa nyid 'di shes par byed pa la de nyid 'di'i dgongs pas rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: This very equalizing is what makes this known, and that very thing is what is intended here.

original: gang gi phyir ma blangs pa la sbyin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma blangs pa la sbyin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not right to give what has not been accepted.

original: yin na zhes bya ba smos pa gang yin ba de yang drang srong gi ye shes kyis tha snyad ma yin no //
analyzed: yin na zhes bya ba smos pa gang yin ba de yang drang srong gi ye shes kyis tha snyad ma yin no //
translated: As for what was said about “if it is,” that is not a convention of the knowledge of the sages.

original: rab tu grags pa can gyis kyang sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa can gyis kyang sdug bsngal te /
translated: Even those who are well known suffer.

original: de lta bur gyur pa las bsal bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa las bsal bar shes pa'o //
translated: It is known that such a one is to be removed from that state.

original: de bas na 'di lta bu'i dbang brtsan kho na de rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di lta bu'i dbang brtsan kho na de rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this very authority is what is intended here.

original: gang zhig 'dir ji srid du blangs pa de srid du cha gsum bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir ji srid du blangs pa de srid du cha gsum bya'o //
translated: As for what was said about “as long as it is accepted here, for that long there are three parts,”

original: lhag ma ni dge 'dun nyid la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni dge 'dun nyid la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the remainder is said to be for the Saṅgha itself.

original: de yang de nyid kyi phyir gzung bar dka' bas zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de yang de nyid kyi phyir gzung bar dka' bas zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
translated: And that is also seen to be difficult to grasp for that very reason.

original: de ni gzung bar dka' ba 'dis lhag par phul ba la skyon yon yang med de /
analyzed: de ni gzung bar dka' ba 'dis lhag par phul ba la skyon yon yang med de /
translated: There is no fault or virtue in this additional difficulty of grasping.

original: de bas na thams cad blangs pa la bgo bsha' byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad blangs pa la bgo bsha' byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “sharing in all.”

original: lag gi blas zhes smos pa ni 'dir mtshon pa tsam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lag gi blas zhes smos pa ni 'dir mtshon pa tsam du rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “with his own hands” should be understood as merely an illustration here.

original: gzhan du yang 'dis dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor blangs shing khyer ba gnyis yin no snyam du shes nas /
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'dis dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor blangs shing khyer ba gnyis yin no snyam du shes nas /
translated: Otherwise, one should understand that he has taken and carried off the property of the Three Jewels.

original: de'i dkor la yang 'bul bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dkor la yang 'bul bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to offer him the property of the Three Jewels.

original: nad g-yog dang bcas pa nyid yin na yo byad drug po de bdag dbang ba nyid yin bas byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad g-yog dang bcas pa nyid yin na yo byad drug po de bdag dbang ba nyid yin bas byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he is a nurse, then since those six articles belong to him, they should not be consecrated.

original: de dbang ba nyid yin bas zhes bya ba ni de nad g-yog de dbang ba nyid yin pas dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis mi brlab par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dbang ba nyid yin bas zhes bya ba ni de nad g-yog de dbang ba nyid yin pas dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis mi brlab par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since they belong to him, they should not be consecrated by the monks.

original: de'i rab dang 'bring dang tha ma dang bcas pa las so zhes bya ba ni de la kha cig ni dge @130b slong gi yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i yo byad rab las sbyin bar bya'o //🔽kha cig ni 'bring /
analyzed: de'i rab dang 'bring dang tha ma dang bcas pa las so zhes bya ba ni de la kha cig ni dge @130b slong gi yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i yo byad rab las sbyin bar bya'o // kha cig ni 'bring /
translated: The phrase “according to their superior, middling, and inferior status” means that some are to be given the superior requisites of a monk and the requisites for his livelihood.🔽Some are to be given the middling,

original: kha gcig ni tha ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kha gcig ni tha ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and some are to be given the inferior.

original: gsum po 'di dang bcas pa drug po sbyin bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽du ma nyid yin na thun mong ngo zhes bya ba ni nad g-yog gnyis sam gsum mam mang po nyid yin na /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dang bcas pa drug po sbyin bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // du ma nyid yin na thun mong ngo zhes bya ba ni nad g-yog gnyis sam gsum mam mang po nyid yin na /
translated: The meaning is that these six are to be given according to their superior, middling, and inferior status.🔽If there are many, they are to be shared.

original: yo byad drug po de dag gi thun mong nyid yin no //🔽de'i don du song ba nyid yin la nad pa shi na sbyin par bya ba nyid ces bya ba la /🔽de'i don du zhes bya ba ni nad pa de'i don du'o //
analyzed: yo byad drug po de dag gi thun mong nyid yin no // de'i don du song ba nyid yin la nad pa shi na sbyin par bya ba nyid ces bya ba la / de'i don du zhes bya ba ni nad pa de'i don du'o //
translated: If there are two, three, or many nurses, the six requisites are to be shared.🔽If the patient dies, they are to be given to the nurses.🔽The phrase “for the sake of” means “for the sake of the patient.”

original: bcas ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcas ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the patient dies, they are to be given to the nurses.

original: gal te nad pa'i don du nad g-yog dang bcas par 'gyur ba de lta bas na yang yo byad drug po 'di sbyin par bya ba nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te nad pa'i don du nad g-yog dang bcas par 'gyur ba de lta bas na yang yo byad drug po 'di sbyin par bya ba nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is for the sake of the sick person, then the six articles should be given to the nurse.

original: dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: The question of the son of the brahmin bhikṣu says:

original: de dag la sogs pa 'dir bsnyen par ma gnas par khas blangs pa la yo byad drug po dag mi sbyin par mi gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa 'dir bsnyen par ma gnas par khas blangs pa la yo byad drug po dag mi sbyin par mi gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Here, it is not said that the six articles should not be given to those who have not taken up the precepts.

original: rdzas de mi dbang ba la ni de mi sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas de mi dbang ba la ni de mi sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should not give that substance to one who is not its owner.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni drug po de mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni drug po de mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the six articles.🔽“One should not give” means that it is not to be given.

original: khyim pa la sogs pa rnams la nad g-yog gis bya ba nyid kyi phyir spyi la bya bar bkag pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa la sogs pa rnams la nad g-yog gis bya ba nyid kyi phyir spyi la bya bar bkag pa'o //
translated: Since householders, etc. are to be served as nurses, it is prohibited in general.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: btsun ba bro g-yog khyim pa lags na /
analyzed: btsun ba bro g-yog khyim pa lags na /
translated: “Venerable, if the nurse is a layperson,

original: de la bro g-yog gi chos gos brtsal bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: de la bro g-yog gi chos gos brtsal bar bgyi 'am /
translated: should one seek Dharma robes for the nurse?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: cung zad kyang sbyin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: cung zad kyang sbyin par mi bya ste /
translated: “One should not give anything at all.

original: de bzhin du nad g-yog ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul ma la yang sbyin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad g-yog ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul ma la yang sbyin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: gang la yang mtshan mi mthun pa dag 'ba' zhig yod na mtshan mthun pa dag med pa der mtshan mi mthun ba dag la yad sbyin par bya ba nyid yin bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang mtshan mi mthun pa dag 'ba' zhig yod na mtshan mthun pa dag med pa der mtshan mi mthun ba dag la yad sbyin par bya ba nyid yin bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If a nun has only the characteristics of a non-human, and does not have the characteristics of a human, then it should be understood that the requisites are to be given to those who have the characteristics of a non-human.

original: de la mtshan mi mthun ba dag la 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan mi mthun ba dag la 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are suitable for those who have the characteristics of a non-human.

original: gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la mi sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhan rnams ni phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos kyi glegs bam mo //

original: myur bar bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: myur bar bsgrub par bya ste /

original: myur bar 'bri bar khar gsil gyi yu ba dang / btsag dang rnams la sogs pa tshon chen po rnams las nges par grol pa'i kha dog ces bya ba ni 'di rnams kyis kha dog gi sgra 'di bsdus par byas kyi /
analyzed: myur bar 'bri bar khar gsil gyi yu ba dang / btsag dang rnams la sogs pa tshon chen po rnams las nges par grol pa'i kha dog ces bya ba ni 'di rnams kyis kha dog gi sgra 'di bsdus par byas kyi /
translated: The phrase with colors other than the great colors refers to the colors of a peacock's neck, lapis lazuli, etc., which are not the great colors such as vermilion, indigo, etc. The phrase with colors definitely freed from those means that the word colors is to be supplied here.

original: tshon rtsi dang khar gsil gyi yan lag tu gyur pa kha dog byed pa la bsdu ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshon rtsi dang khar gsil gyi yan lag tu gyur pa kha dog byed pa la bsdu ba'i don du ni ma yin no //

original: gnyis par zhes bya ba ni go bar 'os pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnyis par zhes bya ba ni go bar 'os pa nyid du'o //
translated: The word second means that it is suitable to be understood.

original: 'bras dang til dang nas dang mon sran sde'u dang mon sran gre'u dang / 'bru gzhan dang bza' ba dang btung ba dag ni gsum par 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras dang til dang nas dang mon sran sde'u dang mon sran gre'u dang / 'bru gzhan dang bza' ba dang btung ba dag ni gsum par 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /

original: gsum par zhes bya ba bza' bar 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsum par zhes bya ba bza' bar 'os pa nyid do //

analyzed: gzhir gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi'o // glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed pa dag mnyam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang 'dir glegs bu rnams kyang so so mnyam pa nyid dang / glegs bu byed rnams kyang logs shig tu @132b mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word basis refers to the basis of robes.🔽The word equal means that the leaves should be equal, and the leaves should be equal separately. The word equal should be understood in this way.🔽The word equal means that the leaves should be equal with the half-leaves.

original: glebs bu yang glegs bu phyed rnams dang lhan cig tshad ma nyam par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: glebs bu yang glegs bu phyed rnams dang lhan cig tshad ma nyam par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: mnyam pa 'di ni mdzes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa 'di ni mdzes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This equality is for the sake of beauty.

original: gzhal ba'i phyir de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhal ba'i phyir de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to measure it, a cubit should be made, the measure of which is that.

original: de'i tshad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The measure of which is that means

original: glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed kyi tshad la don gyi dbang gis 'chang ba 'di'o //
analyzed: glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed kyi tshad la don gyi dbang gis 'chang ba 'di'o //

analyzed: de ltar yang gzhal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to measure it in that way, it is said.

original: de bas na 'di rjes su gnang ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di rjes su gnang ba ste /

original: nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not definite.

analyzed: gcig gis dgos pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur na de tsam 'chang ba la nyes byas nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If one need is accomplished by one, there is no offense in keeping just that much.

original: de ltar yang gzhan las chag shing kho na bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhan las chag shing kho na bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: In that way, it is said in another text that only a cubit should be kept.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /🔽chag shing bya zhing de'i tshad kyi glegs bu bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa / chag shing bya zhing de'i tshad kyi glegs bu bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“A cubit should be made, and a tablet of that measure should be made.

analyzed: glegs bu'i tshad kyi glegs bu phyed bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: gang zhig 'dir chag shing gi sgra las don tha dad par zhes bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir srog shing ni chag shing du gyur pa nyid du gsungs pa rnams par gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: gang du gdong gi chag shing las 'di la shin tu che ba nyid bstan pa'i don du chug shing gi sgra'o //
translated: Where the word pillar is used for the sake of showing its great size in comparison to the face, it is like in the statement The pillar is very large.

analyzed: tshal bu dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du bya'o // de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The pieces should also be equal means they should be equal.🔽The pillar should be cut to the size of the pieces means

analyzed: gzhag pa'i phyir tshal bu'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pillar should be cut to the size of the pieces means The pieces should be placed in order.

original: de'i tshad ni sor bzhi'o zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni tshal bu la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni sor bzhi'o zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni tshal bu la'o //
translated: The size of that is four finger breadths means That refers to the pieces.

original: bya rog gi mtho gang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya rog gi mtho gang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is one crow's beak means

analyzed: mthe bo'i logs su sor mo gang yin pa de'i dbus kyi tshigs kyi logs stengs su mthe bo'i tshigs su gtad de /

analyzed: gang zhig sor bcu gnyis par gyur pa yin pa de ni bya rog gi mtho gang dang 'dra bar brjod pa'o //

original: 'di'i tshad ni sor bzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di'i tshad ni sor bzhi kho na ste /
translated: The measure of a small space is four fingers.

original: de bas na de nyid la de rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid la de rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught in another way.

original: chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam phyed dang gsum ma mthe bo sor gcig go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam phyed dang gsum ma mthe bo sor gcig go zhes bya ba ni /

original: sor gnyis ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: sor gnyis ni thob pa'o //

original: gang gi phyir chung ba ni sor bzhi pa dang / chung tshad ni sor phyed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chung ba ni sor bzhi pa dang / chung tshad ni sor phyed dang gsum mo //

original: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad du ste de'i bar ni 'bring du'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽gzhung kha cig las ni che tshad ni sor bzhi 'am /
analyzed: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad du ste de'i bar ni 'bring du'o zhes 'byung ngo // gzhung kha cig las ni che tshad ni sor bzhi 'am /
translated: The middle is the measure of a medium space.

original: bya rog gi mtho gang ngo //
analyzed: bya rog gi mtho gang ngo //

original: chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam mtheb sor gcig go //
analyzed: chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam mtheb sor gcig go //

original: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad do zhes gsungs @133a * //
analyzed: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad do zhes gsungs @133a * //

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //

analyzed: su zhig sbyor ba la thams cad sbyor bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba bsdus te nye bar btags pa 'di byas so //
translated: Who would apply to all? This is the summary designation that is made.

original: sa la chos gos gding bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sa la chos gos gding bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not spread out one's Dharma robes on the ground.

original: de'i don du gtan pa bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don du gtan pa bya'o //
translated: For that purpose, a mat should be made.

original: shing las byas pa'am smyig ma las byas pa gru bzhi pa rtod pa'i phyir thug gzhug pa'i bu ga btod pa ni de zhes bya ba ni thang bcad cing bcing ba'i phyir tha gu gang yin pa de rtod pa'i bu ga btod par gyur pa de ni gtan
analyzed: shing las byas pa'am smyig ma las byas pa gru bzhi pa rtod pa'i phyir thug gzhug pa'i bu ga btod pa ni de zhes bya ba ni thang bcad cing bcing ba'i phyir tha gu gang yin pa de rtod pa'i bu ga btod par gyur pa de ni gtan
translated: Made of wood or bamboo, square, with a hole for tying, is called that. That which is a rope for tying and spreading out, having a hole for tying, is called a mat.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni don to //
translated: The meaning is that.

original: chos gos ji tsam par ro zhes bya ba ni bcos gos dang 'tshams pa'i tshad bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gos ji tsam par ro zhes bya ba ni bcos gos dang 'tshams pa'i tshad bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: chos gos tshad tha dad pa du ma yod pas gtan pa yang don gyis 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nas so //

analyzed: yu ba rtsi can dang khra bo mi bcang ngo zhes du ma bya dogs par rig par bya'o //

original: gri gus dra'o //
analyzed: gri gus dra'o //
translated: It should be carried in a sheath.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be carried.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gri gu de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gri gu de'o //

original: bya rog gi mchu lta bu dang / bya gag gi gshog pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: bya rog gi mchu lta bu dang / bya gag gi gshog pa lta bur ro //

analyzed: lcags las byas pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: lcags kyi rang bzhin kho na las bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it should be made of iron.

original: don gyis 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba byas nas so //
analyzed: don gyis 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba byas nas so //
translated: Because it is used for a purpose.

original: yu ba rtsi cas dang khra bo mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yu ba rtsi cas dang khra bo mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The handle should not be made of bamboo or of many colors.

analyzed: yu ba mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “it should not be carried” is understood.

analyzed: sor drug gi tshangs las lhag pa mi bcang mgo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should not be carried more than six fingerbreadths beyond the forehead.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gri gu ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gri gu ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of knives:

original: chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
analyzed: chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: chen po ni sor drug go //
analyzed: chen po ni sor drug go //
translated: The large one is six fingerbreadths.

original: chung ngu ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The small one is four fingerbreadths.

original: de'i bar ni 'bring ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bar ni 'bring ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The middle is the one in between.

original: de las mang ba nyid ni spang bar rig pa yin te /
analyzed: de las mang ba nyid ni spang bar rig pa yin te /
translated: The larger is to be rejected.

original: de las chung ba nyid kyis ni dogs pa mi 'grub par brjod pa zhes bya ba 'dor de'i bsdus pa nyid shes nas de ltar smos so //
analyzed: de las chung ba nyid kyis ni dogs pa mi 'grub par brjod pa zhes bya ba 'dor de'i bsdus pa nyid shes nas de ltar smos so //
translated: The smaller is not to be accepted, because it is not established as a doubt.

original: kha cig las ni brgyad las mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'di nye bar btags pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig las ni brgyad las mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'di nye bar btags pa ste /
translated: In some texts, it is said that the knife should not exceed eight fingerbreadths.🔽This is a variant reading.

original: 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni /
translated: In some texts, it is said:

analyzed: gri gu sor brgyad kyi tshad las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “One should not keep a knife exceeding eight fingerbreadths.”

original: 'dir gzhung chen po ni sor brgyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung chen po ni sor brgyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the authoritative text says eight fingerbreadths.

original: shing bu thur pa nyid la de yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: shing bu thur pa nyid la de yod par gyur na'o //
translated: If it is longer than that, it is not to be kept.

analyzed: de lta bas na mi rigs par gyur pa 'di zhes bya ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is seen to be unreasonable.

original: sor bzhi bas thung ba ni dgos pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sor bzhi bas thung ba ni dgos pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A knife shorter than four fingerbreadths is not necessary.

original: ma lus pa ma yin par dgos pa la dgongs nas dgos pa med pa nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa ma yin par dgos pa la dgongs nas dgos pa med pa nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: The purpose is not to be taught without remainder, but with remainder, with the intention of a purpose.

original: dgos pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The purpose is not the only thing that is taught.

original: gang gi phyir de las rnam pa thams cad du dgos pa mi 'grub pa ni ma yin @133b no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las rnam pa thams cad du dgos pa mi 'grub pa ni ma yin @133b no ;
translated: Because the purpose is not completely unaccomplished.

original: lci ba'i byug pas bskus par btsem mo zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'am rgyud pas btsem par bya ba'i chos gos la gnas gang yin pa de la rdul ldang ba med par bya ba'i phyir lci ba'i gyur pas bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: lci ba'i byug pas bskus par btsem mo zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'am rgyud pas btsem par bya ba'i chos gos la gnas gang yin pa de la rdul ldang ba med par bya ba'i phyir lci ba'i gyur pas bsku bar bya'o //
translated: It is sewn with a paste of clay means that on the robe which is the basis of the Dharma that is to be sewn, either with a substance or with thread, one should apply a paste of clay in order to prevent dust from arising.

original: lci ba med na chag chag gdab cing phyags par ro //
analyzed: lci ba med na chag chag gdab cing phyags par ro //
translated: If there is no clay, one should sprinkle water and sweep.

original: de btsem par bya'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni chos gos so //
analyzed: de btsem par bya'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni chos gos so //

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni / dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing ngam /
translated: Here is the text:🔽Monks, a robe should be sewn with whatever is available, such as a bamboo splinter or a piece of reed.

original: smyig ma'i tshal bu gang yin pas chos gos dag 'tshem par bya'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir mdo 'di byas pa'o //
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal bu gang yin pas chos gos dag 'tshem par bya'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir mdo 'di byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this sūtra was composed.

original: khab kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba la kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya gag gi gshog shing dang smyig ma'i tshal bu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khab kyis kyang btsem du rung ba'o //
analyzed: khab kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba la kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya gag gi gshog shing dang smyig ma'i tshal bu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khab kyis kyang btsem du rung ba'o //
translated: Also with a needle - the word also indicates that it is not only the wing of a cock and a piece of bamboo that are suitable for sewing, but also a needle.

original: bya gag gi gshog shing la sogs pa las de dang mthun pa ste khab kyis ni ma yin te /🔽khab kyis 'tshem pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bya gag gi gshog shing la sogs pa las de dang mthun pa ste khab kyis ni ma yin te / khab kyis 'tshem pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: But it is not suitable for sewing with a cock's wing, etc., because it is not like that.

original: 'dis 'tshem par byed pa'i bshad pa zhes te shes par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis 'tshem par byed pa'i bshad pa zhes te shes par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The form of sewing with a needle - this is not to be understood as an explanation that this is sewing with a needle.

original: dra ba'i gzhung ni dge slong dag lag pa dag gis bral bar byed pa na ma rung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dra ba'i gzhung ni dge slong dag lag pa dag gis bral bar byed pa na ma rung bar gyur nas /
translated: The text on nets: Monks, when they were separating with their hands, it became unfit.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gri gus dra bar ba'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gri gus dra bar ba'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be sewn with a knife.

original: khab kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing dang / smyig ma'i tshal bus chos gos dag 'tshem pa na /
analyzed: khab kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing dang / smyig ma'i tshal bus chos gos dag 'tshem pa na /
translated: The text on needles: Monks, when they were sewing robes with the wing of a cock and a piece of bamboo,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: khab bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khab bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should carry a needle.

original: de la dra ba nyams pa'i skyon la brten nas nges par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dra ba nyams pa'i skyon la brten nas nges par shes pa'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that the fault of the broken net is certain.

original: khab kyis nyes pa la mngon par ma brten pas 'phags pa bku la gleng gzhi'i rgyu las mi ldog par rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: khab kyis nyes pa la mngon par ma brten pas 'phags pa bku la gleng gzhi'i rgyu las mi ldog par rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Since the fault of the needle is not certain, the noble one is permitted to carry it, without being bound by the cause of the origin story.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khab de'o //
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khab de'o //

analyzed: bye brag gsum yan chad du'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: ba'o ; / tshon gyis kun nas bsubs pa'i gos de la tshon dang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir mtha' dbyar bas so zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: tshon phyogs gcig tu song par ma gyur cig snyam du 'di yang nas yang du bsgyur bzlog bya'o //

analyzed: tshon sar pa ni sar pa dag la blugs na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bang rim dang 'chags tshon gyi las mi bya'o // gtsug lag khang du mi bya'o //

original: de'i steng du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de'i steng du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ;

original: de zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi steng du'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi steng du'o //

analyzed: tshong yi las de byed pa de ni de'i gnas yin gyis bang rim la sogs pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'thor 'thung bya ba'i nyen kor du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshon gyi las mi bya'o //

analyzed: phyogs der zhal zhal bya'o //

analyzed: gal te rdo thal gyis byugs pa yin na bkru'o //

analyzed: gal te brtsams pa na rlung dang char 'ong na khyams su bya'o //
translated: If it is begun and wind and rain come, it should be done in a courtyard.🔽When it is finished, that place should be smeared with cow dung or earth.

original: byas zin nas phyogs der lci ba'am sas byug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byas zin nas zhes bya ba ni tshon gyi las so //
analyzed: byas zin nas phyogs der lci ba'am sas byug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byas zin nas zhes bya ba ni tshon gyi las so //
translated: When it is finished means when the painting work is finished.

original: bcag pa dang brdabs pas rung bar ma gyur pa spyad pa bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gos bcag pa dang / brdabs pas rung bar ma gyur cing ma grub pa dang 'dra ba ma grub pa'i gos bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcag pa dang brdabs pas rung bar ma gyur pa spyad pa bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gos bcag pa dang / brdabs pas rung bar ma gyur cing ma grub pa dang 'dra ba ma grub pa'i gos bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not use a robe that is torn or damaged by trampling. A robe that is torn and damaged by trampling is like an unfinished robe, so one should not use an unfinished robe.

original: yang 'dir rung ba gang yin pa gang dub sten par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'dir rung ba gang yin pa gang dub sten par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Here, what is suitable and where should it not be used?

original: de'i phyir 'di la 'tshor ba nyams pa ni rung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la 'tshor ba nyams pa ni rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, the loss of burning is suitable.

original: chus brlan pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: chus brlan pa nyid na'o //
translated: When it is moistened with water.

original: zil pas brlan nas lag pas mnye bas nyams par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: zil pas brlan nas lag pas mnye bas nyams par bya ba la'o //
translated: When moistened with dew, it should be damaged by rubbing with the hand.

original: sham thabs bgos pa'i steng du ska rags @135b bcing ngo zhes bya ba ni sham thabs bgos pa'i ster du ska rags bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: sham thabs bgos pa'i steng du ska rags @135b bcing ngo zhes bya ba ni sham thabs bgos pa'i ster du ska rags bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase having put on the lower robe, one should fasten the belt means that one should fasten the belt while wearing the lower robe.

original: ci zhig bcing bar bya zhe na /🔽de'i phyir shur bu 'am lcag pod dam /
analyzed: ci zhig bcing bar bya zhe na / de'i phyir shur bu 'am lcag pod dam /
translated: What is it that one should fasten?

original: rgya cang ngam shur bu phre 'us so zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: rgya cang ngam shur bu phre 'us so zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: The text says, a sash, a belt, a girdle, or a belt with a clasp.

original: skud pa mang po las btags ba srab la zheng che ba dang / lhas ma gru bzhir 'dug pa dang / skud pa mang pos btags pa nyid la bar khod stong du 'dug pa dang / skud pa phra mo las btags pa mdo mdor bu gu lnga 'am drug rim du byas pa btod pa rnams go rims ji lta bzhin du'o //🔽ska rags ma bcings par grong du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skud pa mang po las btags ba srab la zheng che ba dang / lhas ma gru bzhir 'dug pa dang / skud pa mang pos btags pa nyid la bar khod stong du 'dug pa dang / skud pa phra mo las btags pa mdo mdor bu gu lnga 'am drug rim du byas pa btod pa rnams go rims ji lta bzhin du'o // ska rags ma bcings par grong du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A sash is a narrow, wide, or multi-stranded cord. A belt is a multi-stranded cord with a clasp. A girdle is a multi-stranded cord with a gap in the middle. A belt with a clasp is a cord made of fine strands, with five or six loops.🔽 One should not enter a village without fastening the belt,

original: sham thabs bgos pa'i steng du ska rags ma bcings par grong du 'jug par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: sham thabs bgos pa'i steng du ska rags ma bcings par grong du 'jug par mi bya ba ste /
translated: means that one should not enter a village without fastening the belt over the lower robe.

original: 'di ni sham thabs brlag par 'gyur pa spang ba'i phyir ro //🔽khris gcig gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni sham thabs brlag par 'gyur pa spang ba'i phyir ro // khris gcig gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is to avoid losing the lower robe.🔽Even with one belt, it is not proper.

original: gal te ska rags khris gcig gis bcings na de ltar na yang mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: gal te ska rags khris gcig gis bcings na de ltar na yang mi rung ba'o //
translated: If one ties it with one belt, it is not proper.

original: tshom bu can dang tshar tshar can dang zla gam can dang gser skud ni rgyan ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshom bu can dang tshar tshar can dang zla gam can dang gser skud ni rgyan ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one with a patch, the one with a fringe, the one with a half-moon, and the one with a golden thread are not ornaments.

original: rgyan thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o zhes smos pas de rnams bkag bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o zhes smos pas de rnams bkag bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it is said that one should not rely on wearing ornaments, those should be understood as prohibited.

original: khra bor byas pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khra bor byas pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The variegated one is also like that.

original: rgyan bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgyan bzhin du'o //
translated: Like an ornament.

original: mdo 'di ni gos kyi dun du byas pa yin gyi rtsva las byas pa'am /
analyzed: mdo 'di ni gos kyi dun du byas pa yin gyi rtsva las byas pa'am /
translated: This sutra is about a cloth patch, but one made of grass or

original: de las gzhan pa yang rgyan nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang rgyan nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: something else is also included in the category of ornaments.

original: gzhi ma bting ba'i sar chos gos bzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi ma bting ba'i sar chos gos bzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not place the Dharma robe on the ground without a base.

original: 'dir thams cad bar du gcod pa dang / ma nyams par ras sam lo ma la sogs pa gzhi ma bting ba'i sa la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad bar du gcod pa dang / ma nyams par ras sam lo ma la sogs pa gzhi ma bting ba'i sa la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, all are obstacles, and the ground is not covered with cloth, leaves, etc.

original: de ni ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to avoid damage.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa'i stan gyi gzhi las dge slong rnams tshogs gos dag gyon te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa'i stan gyi gzhi las dge slong rnams tshogs gos dag gyon te /
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya states that when the monks gathered, wearing their robes,

original: sa la 'khod pa na chos gos dag ma rung par gyur pa na /
analyzed: sa la 'khod pa na chos gos dag ma rung par gyur pa na /
translated: and sat on the ground, their robes were damaged.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dad pas sbyin par byas pa chud gsan par mi bya bar 'di ltar stan nang tshangs can la 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pas sbyin par byas pa chud gsan par mi bya bar 'di ltar stan nang tshangs can la 'dug par bya'o //
translated: “Do not waste what is given through faith. Sit on a seat with a lining.”

original: stan nag tshangs can ji lta bu mi shes nas /
analyzed: stan nag tshangs can ji lta bu mi shes nas /
translated: Not knowing what a seat with a lining was like,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,

original: rtsva'i chun po bcings de ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsva'i chun po bcings de ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Bind a bundle of grass and wrap it in cloth.”

original: 'dir stan nang tshangs can ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'dir stan nang tshangs can ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: Here, a seat with a lining is merely an example.

original: stan gzhan la yang 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: stan gzhan la yang 'dug par bya'o //
translated: One should also sit on another seat.

original: 'di ni chos gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar smos so //
translated: This is said in order to avoid damaging the robes.

original: mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not place them in an unclean place.

original: sa ma yin par gyur @136a * //🔽pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sa ma yin par gyur @136a * // pa la yang ngo //
translated: This means that he should not place them on the ground.

original: btul ba yod na khur lci bas mi mnan no zhes bya ba ni /🔽chos gos mnan par mi bya'o //🔽gzhan du spyod pas yongs su spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni /
analyzed: btul ba yod na khur lci bas mi mnan no zhes bya ba ni / chos gos mnan par mi bya'o // gzhan du spyod pas yongs su spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni /
translated: If he has a disciple, he should not burden him with a heavy load.🔽This means that he should not burden him with the robes.🔽He should not use them in a manner contrary to the rules.

original: 'dir ma mo las stod du bgo ba smad du bgo ba dang smad du bgo ba stod du bgo bas yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ma mo las stod du bgo ba smad du bgo ba dang smad du bgo ba stod du bgo bas yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The text says that he should not use the upper robe as a lower robe, or the lower robe as an upper robe.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba dang mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos bgo ba bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshad ba dang gci ba bya ba dang / mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos dag bgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba dang mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos bgo ba bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshad ba dang gci ba bya ba dang / mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos dag bgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not wear the upper robe while defecating, urinating, or cleaning oneself.

original: der nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not sleep in the upper robe.

original: der zhes bya ba ni bla gos de'i steng du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni bla gos de'i steng du'o //
translated: “In it” means “on the upper robe.”

original: bsod snyoms la rgyu ba dang / mchod ston dang mchod rten la phyag bya ba dad rje sa bya ba dang / dge 'dun tshogs pa dang / gdams ngag dang chos mnyan pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba la snam sbyar bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bgo bar mi bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la rgyu ba dang / mchod ston dang mchod rten la phyag bya ba dad rje sa bya ba dang / dge 'dun tshogs pa dang / gdams ngag dang chos mnyan pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba la snam sbyar bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bgo bar mi bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not wear the patched robe for any activity other than begging for alms, attending a feast, paying respect to a stupa, serving the Saṅgha, or listening to instructions on the Dharma.🔽One should not sit or lie down on it.

original: de la 'dug pa 'am nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de brdzis nas 'dug pa 'am nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dug pa 'am nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de brdzis nas 'dug pa 'am nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: “On it” means “on the patched robe.”

original: des na grva ba rdzi ba yang 'dir bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na grva ba rdzi ba yang 'dir bkag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the carrying of a staff and the wearing of sandals are also prohibited here.

original: ma mo dag las de dag dang mdo 'og ma gnyis so //
analyzed: ma mo dag las de dag dang mdo 'og ma gnyis so //
translated: The other two sutras are from the Mātṛkā.

original: 'ga' yang bskur ba la sbyar ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du ci yang bcug nas bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽lus la reg par bgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang bskur ba la sbyar ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du ci yang bcug nas bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // lus la reg par bgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not put anything into the bowl” means that one should not put anything into the bowl and then carry it.

original: chan khungs g-yas pa'i drod kyis de ma rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chan khungs g-yas pa'i drod kyis de ma rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not touch the body with it” means that one should not touch the body with the bowl.

original: mchan khung gang gi drod kyis 'di nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mchan khung gang gi drod kyis 'di nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: “The heat of the right armpit will spoil it” means that the heat of which armpit will spoil it?

original: de'i phyir g-yas pa'i zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir phyogs der gos glan par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yas pa'i zhes bya ba smos so // de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir phyogs der gos glan par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said “the right.”🔽“In order to prevent that” means in order to prevent it from being spoiled.🔽“In that place” means in the place of the right armpit.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should turn the robe” means one should turn the robe over.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In order to prevent that” means in order to prevent it from being spoiled.

original: phyogs der zhes bya ba ni mchan khung g-yas pa'i phyogs der ro //
analyzed: phyogs der zhes bya ba ni mchan khung g-yas pa'i phyogs der ro //
translated: “In that place” means in the place of the right armpit.

original: de la zhes bya ba de ni snam sbyar de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba de ni snam sbyar de la'o //
translated: The it refers to the patched robe.

original: khru phyed dang do dang mtho gang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khru phyed dang do dang mtho gang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is half an arm span long and one arm span wide.

original: de'i tshad ni srid du khru phyed dang do zheng du mtho gang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni srid du khru phyed dang do zheng du mtho gang ngo //
translated: Its size is half an arm span long and one arm span wide.🔽It is sewn with a string on both sides.🔽 It is sewn evenly on both sides.

original: ngos gnyis kar skud pa'i brungs kyis sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni ngos gnyis kar mnyam bar glan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i don rtogs par bya'o //🔽gzhan du ni gnyis ka las /
analyzed: ngos gnyis kar skud pa'i brungs kyis sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni ngos gnyis kar mnyam bar glan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i don rtogs par bya'o // gzhan du ni gnyis ka las /
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way.🔽 Otherwise, it is sewn on both sides.

original: ngos gnyis kar glan par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngos gnyis kar glan par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is sewn on both sides.

original: skud pa'i zungs kyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sten pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skud pa'i zungs kyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sten pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is sewn with a string, not with a needle.

original: dus dus su de bkru @136b ba dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o //🔽de'i de ni btsag gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus dus su de bkru @136b ba dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o // de'i de ni btsag gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From time to time it should be washed and dyed.🔽Its dyeing is done with cow dung.

original: gos de'i kha bsgyur ba de ni btsag gis rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: gos de'i kha bsgyur ba de ni btsag gis rigs par bya'o //
translated: The dyeing of that cloth should be done with cow dung.

original: gdong phyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gdong phyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: A face-washing cloth should be kept.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gnas brtan gyis dris pa rung ram /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gnas brtan gyis dris pa rung ram /
translated: Here the text is: Is it proper to ask the elder?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rnams bdag ni nad pas te mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rnams bdag ni nad pas te mi rung ngo //
translated: “Venerable ones, I am sick, so it is not suitable for me.”

original: ci khyod sngon gdong phyis bcang bar byas na da ltar ci'i phyir mi 'chang /
analyzed: ci khyod sngon gdong phyis bcang bar byas na da ltar ci'i phyir mi 'chang /
translated: “Why didn’t you use it before?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo //
translated: “The Blessed One did not allow it.”

original: bar skabs der gsungs pa de bas na gdong phyis bcang bar bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: bar skabs der gsungs pa de bas na gdong phyis bcang bar bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: “Therefore, you should use a face-cloth.”

original: 'dir gdong phyis ni lag phyis la sogs pa dag gi dpe yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gdong phyis ni lag phyis la sogs pa dag gi dpe yin te /
translated: Here, a face-cloth is an example of a hand towel, etc.

original: shin tu mod pa nyid dang shin tu bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu mod pa nyid dang shin tu bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is very small and very forbearing.

original: 'dir gdong pa ni gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'o //🔽lus 'dzag pas rnag gzan no zhes bya ba ni bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gdong pa ni gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'o // lus 'dzag pas rnag gzan no zhes bya ba ni bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the face is taught as the most important.🔽“One whose body oozes pus and blood should use a pus-cloth.”

original: gang gi lus khrag gam rnag 'dzag pa de ni lus 'dzag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi lus khrag gam rnag 'dzag pa de ni lus 'dzag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One whose body oozes blood or pus is called “one whose body oozes.”

original: des rnag gzan bcang par bya'o //
analyzed: des rnag gzan bcang par bya'o //
translated: He should use a pus-cloth.

original: de chos gos kyis nang du bgo'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni lus sprug pa de'o //
analyzed: de chos gos kyis nang du bgo'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni lus sprug pa de'o //
translated: “He should wear it inside his Dharma robes.” “He” refers to the one who shakes his body.

original: dbyar ba ni ska ba'i chu 'am so phag gi phye ma sgyur ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis 'gogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbyar ba ni ska ba'i chu 'am so phag gi phye ma sgyur ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis 'gogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The pus should be removed with a decoction of turmeric or a decoction of brick-bat powder, and it should be dried up slowly.

original: so phag gi phye ma sbyar zhes bya ba ni chus so //
analyzed: so phag gi phye ma sbyar zhes bya ba ni chus so //
translated: The word mixed means mixed with water.

original: rnag dang khrag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ska ba'i chu dang so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis 'gogs bar bya'o ;
analyzed: rnag dang khrag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ska ba'i chu dang so phag gi phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus spangs te dal bus khad kyis 'gogs bar bya'o ;
translated: The pus and blood should be removed with a decoction of turmeric or a decoction of brick-bat powder, and it should be dried up slowly.

original: / dus dus su de bkru ba dang skam pa dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnag gzan no //🔽de ni de'i btsag gis bzad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / dus dus su de bkru ba dang skam pa dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnag gzan no // de ni de'i btsag gis bzad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: From time to time it should be washed, dried, and its color changed. The word it refers to the pus-filled body.🔽 It should be dried up with that drying. The word it refers to the pus-filled body.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnag gzan de kha sgyur bar byed ba ni btsag gi rdul bu gnas 'dzag par spangs pas te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnag gzan de kha sgyur bar byed ba ni btsag gi rdul bu gnas 'dzag par spangs pas te /
translated: Its color should be changed by removing the dripping of the drying powder.

original: de ltar grang mo de med pa zhes bya ba des shes pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar grang mo de med pa zhes bya ba des shes pa'o ;
translated: Thus, it should be dried up without that cold. The word that refers to the pus-filled body.🔽 The earth-essence is good for that. The word that refers to the pus-filled body.

original: /'di'i de la sa'i snying po bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'di'i de la sa'i snying po bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word good means beneficial.

original: 'dzag pa de'i skam ba dang / sha bkrar mi 'gyur ba de'i smad du ni sa'i snying po'i phye ma bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'dzag pa de'i skam ba dang / sha bkrar mi 'gyur ba de'i smad du ni sa'i snying po'i phye ma bzang ngo //
translated: The best is the powder of the earth of an anthill.

original: chos gos gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not put the robe down anywhere at all.

original: skabs 'ga' tsam gzhag pa'i skabs dgag pa ni sngar byas zin pas /
analyzed: skabs 'ga' tsam gzhag pa'i skabs dgag pa ni sngar byas zin pas /
translated: The prohibition of putting it down in some places has already been done.

original: de ni mdzod du gyur pa'i gnas gang yin ba de'i dgag pa yin no //🔽de'i don du gdang bu bca'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos gzhag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ni mdzod du gyur pa'i gnas gang yin ba de'i dgag pa yin no // de'i don du gdang bu bca'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos gzhag pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is the prohibition of the place where the robe is kept.🔽A hook is to be made for the purpose of hanging up the robe.

original: de'i don du sbubs khung bya'o zhes bya ba ni bca' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don du sbubs khung bya'o zhes bya ba ni bca' ba'o //
translated: A hole is to be made for the purpose of making the hook.

original: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni chos gos kyi gdang bca' ba de'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni chos gos kyi gdang bca' ba de'i don du'o //
translated: For the purpose of that means for the purpose of making the robe hook.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i tshe na'o zhes @137a * //🔽bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang rtsig pa'i tshe na'o zhes @137a * // bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: when the monastery is being built.

original: gal te dus de la sbubs khyud de gdod par bya'i //
analyzed: gal te dus de la sbubs khyud de gdod par bya'i //
translated: If the hole is to be made at that time, it is to be made then.

original: brtsigs zin pa'i 'og tu mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtsigs zin pa'i 'og tu mi bya'o //
translated: It is not to be made after the building is finished.

original: rtsig pa'i steng nas dbug par bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: rtsig pa'i steng nas dbug par bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: Or is it to be done in the wall?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir byas zin na bu gu mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de'i phyir byas zin na bu gu mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If it is already done, a hole should not be made.”

original: gtsug lag khang la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the monastery,

original: 'di la gtsug lag khang brtsigs zin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la gtsug lag khang brtsigs zin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it is to be applied here, “If the monastery is already built.”

original: gtsug lag khang ni dpe tsam yin te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni dpe tsam yin te /
translated: The monastery is just an example.🔽It is the same for a house,

original: khang khyim la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gdang bu'i sbubs khung bca' ba'o //
analyzed: khang khyim la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gdang bu'i sbubs khung bca' ba'o //
translated: that is, the making of a hole in the wall.

original: de ni shing bu 'am thag pas 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni shing bu 'am thag pas 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is accomplished by a stick or a rope.

original: gdang bu de bya ba nyid la 'bras bu ma nyams par gzhag pa la dgon pa rnams su de gsungs te /
analyzed: gdang bu de bya ba nyid la 'bras bu ma nyams par gzhag pa la dgon pa rnams su de gsungs te /
translated: That is taught in the wilderness, in the case of the wall itself, when the fruit is not damaged by placing it.

original: yod pa tsam nyid las de rnams la bstan pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa tsam nyid las de rnams la bstan pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The teaching is well-established for them just by its mere existence.

original: de rnams kyis sam gzhan rnams kyis kyang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis sam gzhan rnams kyis kyang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not done by them or by others.

original: de la ma yin no zhes bya ba de gtso bo snyam pa la de skad ces smos so //
analyzed: de la ma yin no zhes bya ba de gtso bo snyam pa la de skad ces smos so //
translated: In that case, it is not. That is said regarding the principal one.

original: gtur bur gos dag bskur na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni chos dag chud za bar 'gyur ba spong ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir de zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gtur bur gos dag bskur na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni chos dag chud za bar 'gyur ba spong ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir de zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is good to give it to the monks is the undertaking of the vow, because it is related to the avoidance of the loss of the Dharma.

original: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtur bu de la'o //🔽khru gsum dang phyed dang gsum gnyis bltab tu byas te btsem mo zhes bya ba ni srid du ni khru gsum mo //
analyzed: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtur bu de la'o // khru gsum dang phyed dang gsum gnyis bltab tu byas te btsem mo zhes bya ba ni srid du ni khru gsum mo //
translated: The phrase it should be made refers to the bag.🔽The phrase three cubits long and one and a half cubits wide means that it should be sewn together in the form of a bag.🔽The length is three cubits.

original: zheng du ni khru phyed dang gsum las gang gi tshad de nyid bltab tu byas pa ni zheng du yin gyi ;🔽srid du ma yin pa ni don gyis go bar bya'o //
analyzed: zheng du ni khru phyed dang gsum las gang gi tshad de nyid bltab tu byas pa ni zheng du yin gyi ; srid du ma yin pa ni don gyis go bar bya'o //
translated: The width is one and a half cubits.

original: dbus su kha gdod do zhes bya ba ni gtur bu de'i'o //
analyzed: dbus su kha gdod do zhes bya ba ni gtur bu de'i'o //
translated: The phrase in the middle, an opening refers to the bag.

original: der kha ran sbu gu can du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der kha ran sbu gu can du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase a tube should be made there means that a tube should be made in the opening.

original: der zhes bya ba ni khar ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni khar ro //
translated: The phrase there means in the opening.

original: khar na sbug gu can ci las bya zhe na /
analyzed: khar na sbug gu can ci las bya zhe na /
translated: What is the tube made of?

original: de'i phyir tha gu las so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha gu las so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase made of string means that it is made of string.

original: kha rgyun gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni tha gus so //
analyzed: kha rgyun gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni tha gus so //
translated: The phrase or of another material means that it is made of another material.

original: spyad par bya ba dag steng du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni gos rnams la'o //
analyzed: spyad par bya ba dag steng du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni gos rnams la'o //
translated: The phrase on the things to be used refers to the robes.

original: sang 'gro bar 'gyur ba nyid na bla ma la zhus te gnang na 'gro bar bya'o //🔽rang gi gnas su chag chag la sogs pa byas te zhes bya ba ni gnas khang na gnas ba de ni 'dir de'i rang gi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sang 'gro bar 'gyur ba nyid na bla ma la zhus te gnang na 'gro bar bya'o // rang gi gnas su chag chag la sogs pa byas te zhes bya ba ni gnas khang na gnas ba de ni 'dir de'i rang gi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If one is going to leave the next day, one should ask permission from the teacher and then leave. 🔽Having sprinkled and so on in one's own dwelling means that one's own dwelling is one's own abode in this context.

original: der gang gis chag chag la sogs pa byas pa de'i ni rang gi gnas der chag chag la sogs pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: der gang gis chag chag la sogs pa byas pa de'i ni rang gi gnas der chag chag la sogs pa byas pa'o //
translated: Having sprinkled and so on in one's own dwelling means having sprinkled and so on in one's own abode.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa'i sgras ni phyag dar dang lci ba 'jam pos byug pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa'i sgras ni phyag dar dang lci ba 'jam pos byug pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word and so on includes sweeping and anointing with soft cow dung.

original: ma mo las /
analyzed: ma mo las /
translated: The Mātṛkā says, One should leave.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'o //🔽lam du chos dang ldan pa'i gtam @137b gyis sam /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'o // lam du chos dang ldan pa'i gtam @137b gyis sam /
translated: This is the phrase one should leave.

original: 'phags pa'i mi smra ba nyid kyis 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i mi smra ba nyid kyis 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should leave by means of a Dharma discussion or by the noble silence.

original: ngal bso ba'i gnas su gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon no //
analyzed: ngal bso ba'i gnas su gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon no //
translated: In the place of rest, one should recite a verse from the scriptures.

original: chu bcus par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas su drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gdon pa'o //
analyzed: chu bcus par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas su drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gdon pa'o //
translated: The words and for the water mean that one should recite the verse spoken by the sage in the place where the water is drawn.

original: su'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: su'i phyir zhe na /
translated: For whom?

original: de'i phyir chu gang gi yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu gang gi yin pa de'i phyir ro //

original: lha rnams kyi phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

original: chu bcus pa'i gnas su yang drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gdon no zhes bya ba ni chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir zhes bya ba don gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu bcus pa'i gnas su yang drang srong gis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gdon no zhes bya ba ni chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir zhes bya ba don gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The words and for the sake of the water gods are understood by implication.🔽 The third continuous recitation is in the place where one stays.

original: gnas par rgyun chags gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhag tu gnas pa'i gnas su rgyun chags gsum pa gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par rgyun chags gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhag tu gnas pa'i gnas su rgyun chags gsum pa gdon par bya'o //
translated: One should hang a rope means

analyzed: dpyang thag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: that one should hang a rope in the well.

original: de'i tshad kyi'o zhes bya ba ni khron pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad kyi'o zhes bya ba ni khron pa de'i 'o //
translated: The words its measure mean the measure of that well,

analyzed: khru brgya yan chad nas brgya lnga bcu man chad do //
translated: from one hundred cubits and above down to fifty cubits.
