analyzed: nub tu ni bram ze'i grong ka ba dang / nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis so zhes bya ba ni nub tu bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba yod ba'i shar gyi cha tshun chad du yul dbus kyi mtshams so //
translated: The eastern part of the two brahmin villages is the boundary of the central region.

original: byang du ni au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang du ni au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the north, the boundary is the mountain called Uśīra.

original: ji ltar au shi ra'i ri'i lho phyogs kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar au shi ra'i ri'i lho phyogs kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: As far as the southern end of the Usīra mountains.

original: mtha' khob tu mchi la lham dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' khob tu mchi la lham dag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should carry shoes in the border regions.

original: gnas mal bskyab pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: gnas mal bskyab pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: Also, for the sake of protecting the bedding.

original: mtha' khob ma yin par yang mchi lham dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' khob ma yin par yang mchi lham dag bcang bar bya'o //

original: rkang pa dang bcas pa'i stan la 'dug pa la gnas ma la rkyang pa mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang bcas pa'i stan la 'dug pa la gnas ma la rkyang pa mi 'grub pa'o //

analyzed: gnas gzhan du song bas kyang gnas mal bskyang bar dgos pa med do //

original: de bas na lam du 'di dag srel bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lam du 'di dag srel bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to carry these on the road.

original: gzhan du song bas kyang rkang pa la dgos pas de dag bgo bar shin tu rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas kyang rkang pa la dgos pas de dag bgo bar shin tu rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is very reasonable to carry them because one needs them for one’s feet.

original: 'di dag @149a * //
analyzed: 'di dag @149a * //
translated: These two

original: lam du song bas kyang rjes su khur ba yang rigs so //
analyzed: lam du song bas kyang rjes su khur ba yang rigs so //
translated: are also reasonable to carry on the road.

original: 'di gnyis la yang mtshon par byed pa'i rtags 'dir yang yod de /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la yang mtshon par byed pa'i rtags 'dir yang yod de /
translated: In these two, the sign of indication also exists here.

original: de'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni bsod snyoms pa zhig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni bsod snyoms pa zhig mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: Therefore, the text here is that a monk who was a pancalika entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: der mchil lham med pas rkang pa dag la ser kha byung ba khyim bdag gis mthong nas des de la smras pa /
analyzed: der mchil lham med pas rkang pa dag la ser kha byung ba khyim bdag gis mthong nas des de la smras pa /
translated: Since he had no sandals, blisters arose on his feet. A householder saw him and said to him,

original: 'phags pa khyod la mchil lham dag med dam /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod la mchil lham dag med dam /
translated: “Noble one, don’t you have sandals?”

original: med do // tshur sheg dang sbyin du gzhug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: med do // tshur sheg dang sbyin du gzhug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “No, I don’t.” “Come here, I will give you some.”

original: ci yang rung ba'i mchi lham gnas mal bskyang ba'i don du mtha' khob dag tu bcang bar bya ba 'am zhi na ;
analyzed: ci yang rung ba'i mchi lham gnas mal bskyang ba'i don du mtha' khob dag tu bcang bar bya ba 'am zhi na ;
translated: One should keep sandals for the purpose of protecting one’s bedding in border regions.

original: de'i phyir tshig rim mo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig rim mo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the order of the words is incorrect.

original: chig rim gang la yod pa de ni tshig rim gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chig rim gang la yod pa de ni tshig rim gcig pa'o //
translated: That which has an incorrect order of words is one with incorrect order of words.

original: de yang 'dir mthil chig pa'i rim can nam rim pa gcig la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang 'dir mthil chig pa'i rim can nam rim pa gcig la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That also means here that it is in one place, or it is in one order.

original: sdogs pa gzhug pas bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa nyid la ni rim pa gzhan sdogs pa gzhug par 'os ba yin no zhes bya ba su zhig sdogs pa gang zhig gis byas pa de slob ma'i don du nges pa 'dir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdogs pa gzhug pas bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa nyid la ni rim pa gzhan sdogs pa gzhug par 'os ba yin no zhes bya ba su zhig sdogs pa gang zhig gis byas pa de slob ma'i don du nges pa 'dir rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the rule for a student.

original: de'i don du gsal bar bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don du gsal bar bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to make its meaning clear, I will explain it.

original: rim pa gzhan ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni sdogs pa rim pa gzhan gzhug pas bcos par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rim pa gzhan ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni sdogs pa rim pa gzhan gzhug pas bcos par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not appropriate to insert a plug in another opening.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: gal te rdol na sdogs pa bcug ste bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rdol na sdogs pa bcug ste bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it ruptures, one should treat it by inserting a plug.

original: rdol na zhes bya ba'i dug byung na'o //
analyzed: rdol na zhes bya ba'i dug byung na'o //
translated: If it ruptures means if it is damaged.

original: khyim pas tha na gom pa mdun du bgos na rim pa mang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyim pas tha na gom pa mdun du bgos na rim pa mang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if there are many openings, for a layperson even a single step forward is sufficient.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: nye ba 'khor khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun bgos par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor khyim pas tha na gom pa bdun bgos par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, for a layperson, even if there are seven steps.

original: rung ba tsam gyi don nyid du de dang sbyar ba'i dbang du len pa ni /
analyzed: rung ba tsam gyi don nyid du de dang sbyar ba'i dbang du len pa ni /
translated: The meaning of mere possibility is taken in the sense of being applied to that.🔽

original: mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rung ba blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The taking of possession in the sense of mere suitability is not the taking of possession of what is unsuitable.🔽In this regard, what is unsuitable is not the taking of possession.

analyzed: mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni blangs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyor ro //

original: gang zhig rim pa gcig pa bya ste bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rim pa dag la dge slong gis bdag tu byas pa de'i 'di bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rim pa gcig pa bya ste bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rim pa dag la dge slong gis bdag tu byas pa de'i 'di bsdus pa'o //

original: rung ba tsam gyis don nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig der rung ba dang ji snyed par gyur pa de tsam gyis don nyid yod pa dang / med pa dang lhag par gyur pa dang mi rung ba'i bstsags par gyur pa dogs pa la de'i sbyor ba'i dbang gis rung ba dang 'brel ba 'byor ba @149b blangs pa ste /

translated: In the sense of mere suitability, whatever is suitable there and to that extent exists, and there is doubt about the accumulation of what is nonexistent, excessive, and unsuitable. The taking of possession is connected with suitability by the power of application.

original: rung ba ma yin ba'i dngos po la bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin ba'i dngos po la bdag gir bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because appropriation does not occur with respect to unsuitable things.

original: khra bo bkra ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad nas 'og gi mdo las sgeg rdzas su gyur pa gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes 'byung ba yan chad mchil lham dag ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khra bo bkra ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad nas 'og gi mdo las sgeg rdzas su gyur pa gzhan dag kyang ngo zhes 'byung ba yan chad mchil lham dag ces bya bar sbyar ro //

original: lug ru lta bu dag bcang bar mi bya'o ;
analyzed: lug ru lta bu dag bcang bar mi bya'o ;
translated: One should not wear shoes that are shaped like a ram’s horns.

analyzed: / aa shvad tha dang ka ra b'i ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dag mi bcang ngo //

analyzed: gser dang dngul gyis spras pa dag mi bcang ngo // thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo //

translated: One should not wear shoes that make a sound like “krog.”🔽One should not wear shoes that make a sound like “tuk.”

analyzed: thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo //

analyzed: krog krog zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis so //

analyzed: de las gzhan ba'i tug tug zer ba dag mi bcang ngo //

analyzed: thrig thrig zer ba dag mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis bsdu bar byas so //

analyzed: de la sgeg rdzas thams cad bkag pa'i gtso bo nyid 'dir rnam par gnas pa yin te /

analyzed: bol ko ba can ni mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one with a heel is not unsuitable, means

translated: Some say: The term for sandals is derived from the water of the nāga’s saliva and the term for sandals is derived from the water of the nāga’s saliva because it is produced from the cause of the water of the nāga’s saliva and it is produced from that and it is produced by the world.🔽

analyzed: su zhig la cung zad bde ba byed pa zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dir rjes su gnang ba'i don to //

translated: This means that in a place where water freezes, one should carry these things.

translated: Since there is no other basis for this meaning, and since there is no rational basis for this here, it should be understood that the meaning of the text is to be interpreted figuratively.

translated: Since it is given in another time, it should be left out in the absence of water, as in the case of the rainy season robe.

analyzed: nad gso ba'i don du ni 'di dag ni nye bar dgos pa'o //
translated: For the purpose of curing illness, these are necessary.

analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba thams cad rjes su gnang bas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: All transgressions of edicts are to be understood as included in the transgression of not being attentive.🔽One should not wear shoes in the presence of a Guru.

original: bla ma'i drung du mchil lham bgo ba bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nyid kyi spyan sngar mchil lham gyon zhing 'chag pa'i dge slong smad pa na dge slong dag la yang tshul de nyid smad pa yin bas
analyzed: bla ma'i drung du mchil lham bgo ba bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nyid kyi spyan sngar mchil lham gyon zhing 'chag pa'i dge slong smad pa na dge slong dag la yang tshul de nyid smad pa yin bas
translated: The Blessed One, having censured the monk who walked about wearing shoes in his presence, also censured the monks for that conduct.

original: de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //🔽seng ge dang stag dang gung dang / glang po che cang shes dang rta cang shes kyi yan lag cung zad kyang lus la gdags @150b par mi bya ba nyid de zhes bya ba la cung zad kyang zhes bya ba yang 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so // seng ge dang stag dang gung dang / glang po che cang shes dang rta cang shes kyi yan lag cung zad kyang lus la gdags @150b par mi bya ba nyid de zhes bya ba la cung zad kyang zhes bya ba yang 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Therefore, this Sutra was composed.🔽One should not wear even a small part of a lion, tiger, leopard, or the limbs of an elephant or horse.🔽Even a small part is also mentioned in the text.

original: phran tshegs dag las seng ge dang de las gzhan ba'i ri dags gtum po rnams la yang 'dir bsnyegs pa'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las seng ge dang de las gzhan ba'i ri dags gtum po rnams la yang 'dir bsnyegs pa'o //
translated: In the Ksudraka Collection, it is said that even a small part of a lion or other fierce animal is to be worn.

original: de dag gis glang po che phal pa dang rta dmu rgod dang / de las gzhan ba'i gcan gzan dag la 'phangs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽de dag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gis glang po che phal pa dang rta dmu rgod dang / de las gzhan ba'i gcan gzan dag la 'phangs pa yin no zhes bya ba la / de dag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are thrown at ordinary elephants, wild horses, and other wild animals.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: glang po che dang stag dang gung dang glang po che cang shes dang / seng ge la sogs pa rnams kyis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che dang stag dang gung dang glang po che cang shes dang / seng ge la sogs pa rnams kyis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “By elephants, tigers, leopards, well-trained elephants, lions, and so on.”

original: mchil lham dag gdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchil lham dag gdab par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not throw shoes.

original: ras ma gsher ba dag gis de dag gi rdul med par bya ba'i phyir phyi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ras ma gsher ba dag gis de dag gi rdul med par bya ba'i phyir phyi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should wipe them with a damp cloth to remove the dust.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni mchil lham mo //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni mchil lham mo //
translated: “Them” refers to the shoes.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽de zhes bya ba ni phyi ba'i ras ma'o //
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la / de zhes bya ba ni phyi ba'i ras ma'o //
translated: “One should carry them” refers to the wiping cloth.

original: de dag brgyu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil lham de dag go //
analyzed: de dag brgyu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchil lham de dag go //
translated: “One should tie them” refers to the shoes.

original: mi mdzes pa'i dngos po dben ba'i phyogs su bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mdzes pa'i dngos po dben ba'i phyogs su bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In a secluded place” means in a place that is not beautiful.

original: lhung bzed glan pa la sogs pa mi mdzes pa'i dngos po thams cad dben pa'i phyogs su las byed pa zhes bya ba khyad par yongs sum bzung bar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed glan pa la sogs pa mi mdzes pa'i dngos po thams cad dben pa'i phyogs su las byed pa zhes bya ba khyad par yongs sum bzung bar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: All unseemly things, such as turning over the begging bowl, are done in a secluded place. This is the accomplishment of the special rule of working in a secluded place.

original: de'i ched du smyung bu dang ko ba bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i ched du smyung bu dang ko ba bcang bar bya ste /
translated: For that purpose, one should carry a needle and a piece of leather,

original: dra gri ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dra gri ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: but not a knife.

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni mchil lham de brgyu ba'i don du'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni mchil lham de brgyu ba'i don du'o // 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, for that purpose means for the purpose of sewing that shoe.

original: smyung bu dang ko ba bcang bar bya'i dra gri ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: smyung bu dang ko ba bcang bar bya'i dra gri ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says, One should carry a needle and a piece of leather, but not a knife.

original: khyim gzhan dang chab khungs las gzhan bar shing gi mchil lham bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim gzhan dang chab khungs las gzhan bar shing gi mchil lham bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not wear wooden shoes in other people's houses or at a water source.

original: smyug ma'i glegs bu mun dza dang / si ri dang dar ba dag gis yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: smyug ma'i glegs bu mun dza dang / si ri dang dar ba dag gis yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make them from bamboo, muñja grass, silk, or cotton.

original: tha gu'i yang ngo //
analyzed: tha gu'i yang ngo //
translated: Nor from rope.

original: rlung drag can ma yin bas so zhes bya ba ni gang zag rlung drag can ma yin bas tha gu'i mchil lham bgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rlung drag can ma yin bas so zhes bya ba ni gang zag rlung drag can ma yin bas tha gu'i mchil lham bgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: This means that a person whose wind is not strong should not wear a belt.

original: rlung drag can gyi nad pas ni mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir chag chag gdab pa la 'dir de'i rjes su mthun bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung drag can gyi nad pas ni mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir chag chag gdab pa la 'dir de'i rjes su mthun bar bya'o //
translated: For one whose wind is strong, one should act in accordance with that, sprinkling water here to prevent dryness.

original: 'di ni gtso bor don mnyams par yin gyi nad gso ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gtso bor don mnyams par yin gyi nad gso ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is primarily for the sake of equality, not for curing illness.

original: de lta bas na bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'di ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'di ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this proscribed offense is not unestablished.

original: nad pa la rjes su gnang bas 'dir smyug ma'i glegs bu la sogs pa la phal cher dbul bar byed pa nyid dang shin tu mi mthun par byed pa nyid dang shing gi lham ni shin tu skyon dang ldan ba nyid do //
analyzed: nad pa la rjes su gnang bas 'dir smyug ma'i glegs bu la sogs pa la phal cher dbul bar byed pa nyid dang shin tu mi mthun par byed pa nyid dang shing gi lham ni shin tu skyon dang ldan ba nyid do //
translated: Since it is permitted for the sick, here it is mostly to be offered on bamboo tablets, etc., and it is very incompatible to act otherwise, and wooden shoes are very faulty.

original: de bas na 'dir de'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir de'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, here it is the equivalent of that.

original: khyim gzhan du gzhan med na ko lpags la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyim gzhan du gzhan med na ko lpags la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If there is no other in another house, one should sit on a leather mat.

original: @151a * // gzhan zhes bya ba ni stan gzhan na med na'o //
analyzed: @151a * // gzhan zhes bya ba ni stan gzhan na med na'o //
translated: “Another” means on another seat.

original: der yang rkyen de lta bu dag med na nyal bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der yang rkyen de lta bu dag med na nyal bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If those conditions do not exist there, one should not sleep.”

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi nang du'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi nang du'o //
translated: “There” means in the house.

original: de lta bu dag na'o zhes bya ba ni ko lpags so //
analyzed: de lta bu dag na'o zhes bya ba ni ko lpags so //
translated: “Those conditions” means the leather.

original: 'di ni ma mo las /
analyzed: 'di ni ma mo las /
translated: This is stated in the Mātṛkā:

original: mchil lham du gyur pa'i ko lpags la ko lpags nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mchil lham du gyur pa'i ko lpags la ko lpags nyid ma yin te /
translated: “Leather that has become a shoe is not leather.

original: de'i phyir phreng thag gi cho ga la yul ma yin par shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phreng thag gi cho ga la yul ma yin par shes par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not understand that it is not the object of the rule about the leather strap.”

original: mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir dom lpags bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should keep a bear skin for the sake of benefiting the eyes.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni /🔽dom gyi pags pa blang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni / dom gyi pags pa blang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here is the text:🔽“The Buddha said, ‘I allow you to take a bear skin.’”

original: rkang pa'i gnas su gding bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni do ma lpags blangs pa de'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i gnas su gding bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni do ma lpags blangs pa de'o //
translated: “One should spread it out as a foot mat” means that bear skin that has been taken.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dbang ba'i dom lpags dge slong ngam gzhan gyi dri gtsang khang gi sgor gding bar bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dbang ba'i dom lpags dge slong ngam gzhan gyi dri gtsang khang gi sgor gding bar bcas pa'o //
translated: This refers to the tiger skin belonging to the Buddha, which is spread at the door of the fragrant chamber of a monk or another.🔽One should put on sandals.

original: mchil lham dag tu bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mchil lham dag tu bgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mig la phan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This refers to what is beneficial for the eyes.🔽One who has a wind disease should sit and lie down on it.

original: rlung nad can gyi ni 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni dom gyi pags pa de'i steng du'o //
analyzed: rlung nad can gyi ni 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni dom gyi pags pa de'i steng du'o //
translated: This refers to the tiger skin.🔽All who have hemorrhoids should do the same.

original: gzhang 'brum can thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i gnas su gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir de rnams la rlung nad can dang / lhan cig tu 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhang 'brum can thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i gnas su gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir de rnams la rlung nad can dang / lhan cig tu 'dug pa dang nyal bar yang bya ba smos so //
translated: This refers to spreading it on the place where one's feet are.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
translated: Here, the text of the Kṣudraka Collection says:

original: mchil lham gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchil lham gding bar bya'o //
translated: One should spread sandals.

original: de bas na dge slong gzhang 'brum na bas dom lpags kyi mchil lham dag bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas rkang pa'i gnas su yang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong gzhang 'brum na bas dom lpags kyi mchil lham dag bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas rkang pa'i gnas su yang bcas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha permitted the monk who was afflicted with hemorrhoids to wear shoes made of bear skin.

original: 'dir yo byad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir yo byad ces gsungs so //
translated: Here, the Buddha said “equipment.”

original: de la de ltar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dom gyi pags pa de la'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dom gyi pags pa de la'o //
translated: “One should apply it in this way” means that one should apply the bear skin.

original: spu la reg pas phan par byed pa nyid du reg go zhes bya ba ni dom lpags kyi spu las so //🔽dge slong dag dom lpags kyi spu dag 'og tu ston par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: spu la reg pas phan par byed pa nyid du reg go zhes bya ba ni dom lpags kyi spu las so // dge slong dag dom lpags kyi spu dag 'og tu ston par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “The hairs are beneficial when they touch” means that the hairs of the bear skin are beneficial when they touch the body.

original: spu dag gyen du bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: spu dag gyen du bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: “Monks, the hairs of the bear skin should be turned inward,” and the Blessed One said, “The hairs should be turned outward.” This is included in that.

original: mchil lham dag rim pa mang po nyid kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang phan pa byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mchil lham dag rim pa mang po nyid kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang phan pa byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: “Also, the many layers of the shoes” are also understood to be beneficial.

original: rim pa gcig pa yang thams cad kyis thams cad du phan par byed pa @151b nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rim pa gcig pa yang thams cad kyis thams cad du phan par byed pa @151b nyid yin pas /
translated: Also, the first stage is beneficial in all cases.

original: de bas na rab kyi dgongs pa can te zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab kyi dgongs pa can te zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the intention of the sutra is that the second stage is best.🔽The second stage is also beneficial because it is placed on top of many.

original: du ma'i steng du gcig gzhag pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ko lpags bzhin rim pa du ma'i steng du dom lpags gcig gzhag pas kyang phan par byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: du ma'i steng du gcig gzhag pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ko lpags bzhin rim pa du ma'i steng du dom lpags gcig gzhag pas kyang phan par byed pa nyid du rig go zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The second stage is also beneficial because it is placed on top of many.

original: snga ma'i rnam pa med pa la gang bsten pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i rnam pa med pa la gang bsten pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The first stage is not beneficial because it is not placed on top of many.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is:

original: rim pa mang po dag rnyed pa med nas /
analyzed: rim pa mang po dag rnyed pa med nas /
translated: Since many stages were not available,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: steng du rim pa gcig bcug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽aashm pa ranta dag tu ni ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: steng du rim pa gcig bcug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // aashm pa ranta dag tu ni ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Place the second stage on top.🔽In the Aśvamukha region, one should not not carry leather.

original: yul aashm pa ranta dag tu ni ko lpags ni dga' mgur bcang du gnang ba'o //
analyzed: yul aashm pa ranta dag tu ni ko lpags ni dga' mgur bcang du gnang ba'o //
translated: In the Aśvamukha region, one is permitted to carry leather as one wishes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the treatise is as follows:

original: be'u gsod pa pa'i gleng gzhi las /
analyzed: be'u gsod pa pa'i gleng gzhi las /
translated: In the context of the story of the cow-slayer,

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis ko lpags mi bcang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said, “Therefore, a monk should not hold leather.”

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba yang ko lpags zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba yang ko lpags zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: “One should not hold lion, etc.” is also connected to “leather.”

original: seng ge dang stag dang / glang po che cang shes dang / rta cang shes la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: seng ge dang stag dang / glang po che cang shes dang / rta cang shes la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is a collection of lions, tigers, and elephants, horses, etc.

original: de bas na 'dir yang glang po che la sogs pa dag kyang de rnams kyis bsnyegs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir yang glang po che la sogs pa dag kyang de rnams kyis bsnyegs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, here also elephants, etc. are chased away by them.

original: 'di rnams la nye bar gnas par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de bas na de'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la nye bar gnas par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de bas na de'i byed pa'o //
translated: Since they are not to be kept near, that is their function.

original: gang gis ko lpags mi rung ba nyid yin ba de'i rgyus pa dang / rus pa dang so dang sha la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni srog chags gang gis ko lpags mi rung ba de'i rgyus pa la sogs pa yang mi rung ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ko lpags mi rung ba nyid yin ba de'i rgyus pa dang / rus pa dang so dang sha la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni srog chags gang gis ko lpags mi rung ba de'i rgyus pa la sogs pa yang mi rung ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The flesh, bones, marrow, and teeth of those whose hides are prohibited are also prohibited.

original: 'gro ba dman pa'i de la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dman pa'i de la'o //
translated: The inferior state of existence is for those who use them.

original: rkyal ba ska ba can bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkyal ba ska ba can bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should carry a float made of wood.

original: chu la rgal ba dang chu 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: chu la rgal ba dang chu 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is for crossing water and for holding water.

original: yang na rkyal skya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na rkyal skya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or it is a float.

original: dkar po rkyal skya nyid du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po rkyal skya nyid du brjod pa'o //
translated: It is called a white float.

original: don gsal ba don gyis thob pa mdzad par bya ste /
analyzed: don gsal ba don gyis thob pa mdzad par bya ste /
translated: One should make clear the meaning that is implied by the words.

original: de'i phyir khra bo bkra ba mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir khra bo bkra ba mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should not carry a variegated float.

original: rkyal pa dang rkyal skya'o //
analyzed: rkyal pa dang rkyal skya'o //
translated: It is a float and a float made of wood.

original: rkyal mi shes pas sta gon ma byas par chu'i gting du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkyal mi shes pas sta gon ma byas par chu'i gting du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not enter the water without preparation, not knowing how to swim.

original: ma byas par zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: ma byas par zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Without preparation means that the text here is:

original: gang rkyal mi shes par des rang gi lus su yongs su dor bar mi bya'o zhes 'don pa gcig las gsungs pa'i de'i 'di bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang rkyal mi shes par des rang gi lus su yongs su dor bar mi bya'o zhes 'don pa gcig las gsungs pa'i de'i 'di bsdus pa yin no //
translated: One who does not know how to swim should not give up his body in that way.

original: dben pa'i phyogs su rkyal bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i @152a * //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyogs su rkyal bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i @152a * //
translated: One should learn to swim in a secluded place.

original: don can la rgod bag gi rnam pa nyid kyis rgal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don can la rgod bag gi rnam pa nyid kyis rgal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not swimming with a frivolous attitude, but with the purpose of going.

original: bslab par bya ba ni rgod bag gi rnam pa nyid de bsal na de bzhin du 'di la rjes su bsgrub pa'i snga rol du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni rgod bag gi rnam pa nyid de bsal na de bzhin du 'di la rjes su bsgrub pa'i snga rol du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The frivolous attitude is to be avoided in learning to swim, otherwise one would not be able to stay in the water before learning to swim.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben pa'i sa phyogs su dben pa'i khyams kyi dngos po byed pa de bas na de'i spros pa 'di'o /
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben pa'i sa phyogs su dben pa'i khyams kyi dngos po byed pa de bas na de'i spros pa 'di'o /
translated: A secluded place is a place that is secluded, where one makes a secluded place for oneself. Therefore, this is the elaboration of that.

original: kha cig las mi 'dod pa bzhin du rgal bar 'dod pa de na mi bden te /
analyzed: kha cig las mi 'dod pa bzhin du rgal bar 'dod pa de na mi bden te /
translated: Some people do not want to swim, but that is not right.

original: gang gi phyir stobs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / dmigs kyis bsal ba'i bar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir stobs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / dmigs kyis bsal ba'i bar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not have the strength, etc., and because there is no exception to the rule.

original: de ma yin pa'i gting du khyu mchog ma gtogs pa'i ba lang la brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gting du khyu mchog ma gtogs pa'i ba lang la brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not mount any other cow, except in deep water, and even then only if there is no bull.

original: de ma yin pa'i gting zhes bya ba ni ba lang gis rgal mi nus pa'i gting du'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gting zhes bya ba ni ba lang gis rgal mi nus pa'i gting du'o //
translated: In deep water means in water that is too deep for a cow to cross.

original: mdor gyur pa la yang bye brag ma bzung bar cho ga 'di'o //
analyzed: mdor gyur pa la yang bye brag ma bzung bar cho ga 'di'o //
translated: In brief, this is the rule, without specifying the case.

original: de la mdor gyur pa 'di la brten nas ni bslab pa'i gzhi 'di las 'gal ba'i nyes byas gcig dang / mo la reg pa'i nyes byas gzhan cig dang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mdor gyur pa 'di la brten nas ni bslab pa'i gzhi 'di las 'gal ba'i nyes byas gcig dang / mo la reg pa'i nyes byas gzhan cig dang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In this case, based on this brief statement, there are two offenses: one offense of wrong conduct that violates this training rule, and one offense of wrong conduct for touching a woman.

original: cho ga 'di 'da' bar gyur pa la zhus pa las /
analyzed: cho ga 'di 'da' bar gyur pa la zhus pa las /
translated: This is the rule that is violated.

original: mo la reg par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa las shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mo la reg par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa las shes pa yin no //
translated: It is understood from the statement, “One should not touch a woman.”🔽One should mount an elephant, horse, buffalo, or ox.

original: glang po che dang rta dang ma he dang g-yag dag la brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha cig 'dir g-yag gi gnas su rnga mo 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang ma he dang g-yag dag la brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha cig 'dir g-yag gi gnas su rnga mo 'don pa yin no //
translated: Some include a camel in the place of an ox.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te des rgal mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te des rgal mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is unreasonable, because a camel cannot cross deep water.

original: ko lpags kyi gzhi rdzogs so /
analyzed: ko lpags kyi gzhi rdzogs so /
translated: The Chapter on Leather is finished.

original: // / sman bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: // / sman bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on medicine.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is of four types:

original: dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba nyid do //
analyzed: dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba nyid do //
translated: proper for the time, proper for a watch, proper for seven days, and proper for life.

original: dang po ma yin pa nyid dag ni nad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po ma yin pa nyid dag ni nad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The others are for the sick.

original: 'dir dang po zhes bya ba ni dus su rung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang po zhes bya ba ni dus su rung ba ste /
translated: Here, the first is proper for the time.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa ni dang po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa ni dang po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The others, proper for a watch and so on, are not the first.

original: de'i dngos po ni dang po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dang po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The state of being not the first is not the first.

original: dus su rung ba'i spangs pa'i thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa gsum la nad pa'i yul la brten par bya ba nyid yin gyi mi na ba'i yul la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i spangs pa'i thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa gsum la nad pa'i yul la brten par bya ba nyid yin gyi mi na ba'i yul la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The three, proper for a watch and so on, are to be relied upon in the case of the sick, not in the case of the healthy.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: In the Questions of the Son of a Brahmin Sūtra, it says:

original: btsun pa thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar bya ba'i sman byin gyis brlabs pa gang dag lags pa de dag bro mi @152b 'tshal bas yongs su spyad du rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun pa thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar bya ba'i sman byin gyis brlabs pa gang dag lags pa de dag bro mi @152b 'tshal bas yongs su spyad du rung ngam /
translated: Venerable, is it suitable to consume the medicines that are suitable for one day, for seven days, or for as long as one lives, even if one is not sick?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: Upāli, it is not suitable.

original: byin len bgyis pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa de dag bro 'tshal bas yongs su spyad du rung ngam /
analyzed: byin len bgyis pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa de dag bro 'tshal bas yongs su spyad du rung ngam /
translated: Venerable, is it suitable to consume the medicines that have been consecrated and that have been given and received even if one is not sick?

original: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, it is suitable.

original: btso tsha dang chu shing gi 'bras bu dang / rgya shug dang aa shvadth dang / au dum b'a ra dang rtsub 'gyur dang / rgun chu dang / 'bra go'i btung ba rnams ni thams cad du'o zhes bya ba la thams cad du'o zhes bya ba ni na ba dang /
analyzed: btso tsha dang chu shing gi 'bras bu dang / rgya shug dang aa shvadth dang / au dum b'a ra dang rtsub 'gyur dang / rgun chu dang / 'bra go'i btung ba rnams ni thams cad du'o zhes bya ba la thams cad du'o zhes bya ba ni na ba dang /
translated: The juice of sugarcane, the fruit of the plantain tree, jujube, ashvaattha, udumbara, and the juice of grapes and jujube are suitable in all cases.

original: mi na ba'i phyir btso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba brgyad po 'di rnams la thams cad nyid kyi phyir dang po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi na ba'i phyir btso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba brgyad po 'di rnams la thams cad nyid kyi phyir dang po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: These eight beverages such as boiled water are not the first for everyone, because they are not for the sick.

original: nad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nad pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not for the sick.

original: nad pa kho na'i phyir ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nad pa kho na'i phyir ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not for the sick alone.

original: btsos pa'i tsha dang / 'bru'i tsha dang zho ga chu dang / dar ba'i dangs ma dang / rtsab mo chus btab pa tshags kyis btsags pa shin tu sla ba bzhin snang ba 'dam bu'i nyag ma'i mdog lta bu dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ste btso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba'ang de dang 'dra'o zhes sbyar
analyzed: btsos pa'i tsha dang / 'bru'i tsha dang zho ga chu dang / dar ba'i dangs ma dang / rtsab mo chus btab pa tshags kyis btsags pa shin tu sla ba bzhin snang ba 'dam bu'i nyag ma'i mdog lta bu dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ste btso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba'ang de dang 'dra'o zhes sbyar
translated: Boiled water, water from boiled grain, water from boiled milk, water from boiled meat, water from boiled vegetables, water from boiled fruit, water from boiled roots, and water from boiled leaves.

original: ro // 'di rnams kyang zho ga chu'i bye brag dang ldan pa rnams la thams cad kyi phyir dang po ma yin pa dang btung ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro // 'di rnams kyang zho ga chu'i bye brag dang ldan pa rnams la thams cad kyi phyir dang po ma yin pa dang btung ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These are also not the first for everyone, because they are for those with specific conditions of boiled milk and so on, and the meaning is that they are beverages.

original: 'dir gleng gzhi rnams las mdo 'di gzhung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir gleng gzhi rnams las mdo 'di gzhung ngo //
translated: Here, this sūtra is the text among the sources.

original: spangs pa gdong mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: spangs pa gdong mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'o //
translated: This is the phrase seeing the face of abandonment.

original: thun tshod du rung ba gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish what is suitable for a watch,

original: btung ba ni byed pa'i yan lag nyid la'o //
analyzed: btung ba ni byed pa'i yan lag nyid la'o //
translated: drinking is in the limbs of action itself.

original: de la sil bu rnams las dangs ma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la sil bu rnams las dangs ma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Among those, the essence is called the pure part.

original: 'dir rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here it should be explained in detail.

original: gdong mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdong mthong ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seeing the face is so.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: chang btung ba'i ltung byed kyi zhu ba las /
analyzed: chang btung ba'i ltung byed kyi zhu ba las /
translated: In the request for the downfall of drinking alcohol,

original: btsun pa dus ma yin par bcos pa'i tsha byar rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun pa dus ma yin par bcos pa'i tsha byar rung ngam /
translated: Venerable, is it suitable to drink alcohol that is not distilled at the wrong time?

original: gal te dangs mar gyur na bye brag tu gsal ba gang la bzhin snang ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dangs mar gyur na bye brag tu gsal ba gang la bzhin snang ba'o //
translated: If it has become the pure part, it is the appearance of the face of the specific clarity.

original: myos pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba thams cad dub tung bar gtogs pa dangs ma de la'o //
analyzed: myos pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba thams cad dub tung bar gtogs pa dangs ma de la'o //
translated: Free from intoxication is in all cases the pure part belonging to drinking.

original: de las rjes su mthun par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de las rjes su mthun par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: From that, it is concordant and well-established.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang tshal sogs pa 'di smos so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang tshal sogs pa 'di smos so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that this forest and so on is mentioned in the remaining ones as well.

original: de lta bu nyid kyi mdun rol du bsnyen par rdzogs par mtshan mthun pas reg tu mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i dngos po ni de lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid kyi mdun rol du bsnyen par rdzogs par mtshan mthun pas reg tu mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i dngos po ni de lta bu nyid do //
translated: It is not proper to touch a person of the same sex who is in that condition, prior to full ordination.

original: zho ga chu la sogs pa mdun rol du bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhan mtshan mthun @153a * //🔽pas de la reg tu mi rung ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: zho ga chu la sogs pa mdun rol du bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhan mtshan mthun @153a * // pas de la reg tu mi rung ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is proper to touch a person of the opposite sex who is in that condition, prior to full ordination, if he or she is not a relative.🔽It is not proper to touch a person of the same sex who is in that condition, after full ordination, even if he or she is a relative.

original: ji ltar dus su rung ba'i rdzas kyang btung ba la mdun rol du ni dus ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / btung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar dus su rung ba'i rdzas kyang btung ba la mdun rol du ni dus ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / btung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is proper to touch a person of the opposite sex who is in that condition, after full ordination, if he or she is not a relative.🔽The five substances such as sugarcane, etc., are also proper.

original: aa ru ra la sogs pa lnga yang ngo zhes bya ba ni aa ru ra dang skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang na le sham dang pi pi ling zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: aa ru ra la sogs pa lnga yang ngo zhes bya ba ni aa ru ra dang skyu ru ra dang / ba ru ra dang na le sham dang pi pi ling zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The five substances are myrobalan, pomegranate, jujube, long pepper, and black pepper.

original: bu ram yang ngo zhes bya ba ni thams cad du rung ba ste dang po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bu ram yang ngo zhes bya ba ni thams cad du rung ba ste dang po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Sugar is also proper in all cases, but not at the beginning.

original: de byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba lam du zhugs pa dang / dge skos dang lag gi bla rnams ni nad pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bu ram de zhag bdun pa la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba la ji ltar nad pas dus dad dus ma yin par thams cad du bzar rung
analyzed: de byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba lam du zhugs pa dang / dge skos dang lag gi bla rnams ni nad pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bu ram de zhag bdun pa la sogs par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba la ji ltar nad pas dus dad dus ma yin par thams cad du bzar rung
translated: That consecrated substance is like food for one who has entered the path and the ceremonial master and the master of the rite are like the sick person.

original: ba de bzhin du lam du zhugs pa la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba de bzhin du lam du zhugs pa la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the sick person can eat consecrated molasses at any time, whether it is the proper time or not, so too one who has entered the path can eat it at any time.

original: zan chad pas kyang de dang dus su rung ba ma yin pa bzar rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zan chad pas kyang de dang dus su rung ba ma yin pa bzar rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, one who has fasted can eat that which is not proper at that time.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni de la bu ram byin gyis brlabs pa de yang nad pa de dang 'dra ba nyid du bzar rung la thams cad kyis sam /
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni de la bu ram byin gyis brlabs pa de yang nad pa de dang 'dra ba nyid du bzar rung la thams cad kyis sam /
translated: That means that just as the sick person can eat that consecrated molasses, so too all can eat it.

original: gzhan gyis kyang dus su rung ba dang mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa yang dus ma yin par bzar rung zhing nad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang dus su rung ba dang mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa yang dus ma yin par bzar rung zhing nad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Or others can eat it at the proper time and at the improper time, such as ghee, oil and so on, since they are sick.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi po dag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi po dag brjod par bya ste /
translated: That is said to be of four types.

original: de'i phyir thun tshod du rung ba'i ni btung ba dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thun tshod du rung ba'i ni btung ba dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “drinks that are suitable for a period of time.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: thun tshod du rung ba ni khyim pa'am dge tshul gyis sbyar ba tshags kyis btsags pa dag ni thun tshod du rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba ni khyim pa'am dge tshul gyis sbyar ba tshags kyis btsags pa dag ni thun tshod du rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Drinks that are suitable for a period of time are those prepared by householders or novices and strained with a cloth.

original: kha cig ni thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba brgyad po zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba brgyad po zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some say, “The eight drinks that are suitable for a period of time.”🔽The text says:

original: 'dir gzhung du byed de btso tshe'i btung ba dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu'i btung ba dang / rgya shug gi btung ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung du byed de btso tshe'i btung ba dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu'i btung ba dang / rgya shug gi btung ba'am /
translated: Drinks made from sugar cane, the fruit of the plantain tree, jujube fruit,

original: aa shvadtha'i btung ba'am /🔽au dum b'a ra'i btung ba'am /
analyzed: aa shvadtha'i btung ba'am / au dum b'a ra'i btung ba'am /
translated: ashvaṭha fruit,🔽udumbara fruit,

original: rtsub 'gyur gyi btung ba'am /
analyzed: rtsub 'gyur gyi btung ba'am /
translated: banyan fruit,

original: rgun chu'i btung ba'am /
analyzed: rgun chu'i btung ba'am /
translated: grape juice,🔽and jujube fruit are suitable at all times.

original: 'bra go'i btung ba rnams ni thams cad du bya'i zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bra go'i btung ba rnams ni thams cad du bya'i zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: nad pa ma yin pa la yang de rnams 'os pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nad pa ma yin pa la yang de rnams 'os pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are suitable for those who are not sick.

original: 'bras bu brgyad po 'di rnams khyim pa dang dge tshul gyis sbyar ba /
analyzed: 'bras bu brgyad po 'di rnams khyim pa dang dge tshul gyis sbyar ba /
translated: These eight fruits are to be applied by householders and novices.

original: tshags kyis btsags pa 'di dag ni dus sam dus ma yin par yang na ba'am na ba ma yin pas kyang btung bar bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: tshags kyis btsags pa 'di dag ni dus sam dus ma yin par yang na ba'am na ba ma yin pas kyang btung bar bya ba dag yin te /
translated: They are to be drunk by the sick or not sick, in time or out of time, and they are to be drunk by one who has strained them with a cloth.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should not regret this.

original: @153b dangs ma zhes bya ba ni ska ba nyid bsal ba'o //
analyzed: @153b dangs ma zhes bya ba ni ska ba nyid bsal ba'o //
translated: The term “pure” excludes the state of being turbid.

original: shin tu sla ba'o zhes bya ba ni thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba dag go //
analyzed: shin tu sla ba'o zhes bya ba ni thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba dag go //
translated: “Very easy” means drinks suitable for one hour.🔽Because that substance is not the same as that, if it is suitable for the time, it should be prepared by one not fully ordained and strained with a cloth.

original: de'i rdzas de nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir gal te dus su rung ba nyid yin na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing tshags kyis kyang btsags par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de'i rdzas de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni btung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rdzas de nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir gal te dus su rung ba nyid yin na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing tshags kyis kyang btsags par bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de'i rdzas de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni btung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that substance is not the same as that means because it is not suitable for drinking.

original: de'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni btung bar bya ba'i rdzas de'o //
analyzed: de'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni btung bar bya ba'i rdzas de'o //
translated: That substance means that substance which is to be drunk.

original: gal te dus su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba ni rdzas de'o //
analyzed: gal te dus su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba ni rdzas de'o //
translated: If it is suitable for a time means that substance.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin no /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin no /
translated: If it is prepared by one not fully ordained, it is suitable for a time.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pas sbyar zhing btsags pa la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pas sbyar zhing btsags pa la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is prepared by one fully ordained, it is suitable for a time and also suitable for drinking after straining.

original: de dag las gzhan bal po se'u dang mdu lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi zhes bya ba ni btso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba dag las gzhan pa thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba las /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan bal po se'u dang mdu lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi zhes bya ba ni btso tsha la sogs pa'i btung ba dag las gzhan pa thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba las /
translated: Other than those, substances such as pomegranate and madhuka, etc. means that other than drinks such as boiled sugar-cane juice, etc., drinks suitable for a time,

original: bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas gang zhig rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bsdu ba'i phyir snyegs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bal po se'u dang ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i rdzas gang zhig rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bsdu ba'i phyir snyegs par rig par bya'o //
translated: whatever substances such as pomegranate and madhuka, etc., are used for food such as roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits, should be understood as included.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: sil bu dag las /
analyzed: sil bu dag las /
translated: From the scattered [texts].

original: 'di dang po byas te sings po zhes bya ba'i mthar thug ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dang po byas te sings po zhes bya ba'i mthar thug ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the first, and the last is called the weak.

original: de dus su rung ba nyid yin na thun tshod kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dus su rung ba nyid yin na thun tshod kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is suitable for a certain time, it is the end of the watch.

original: de zhes bya ba ni btung ba'i rdzas de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni btung ba'i rdzas de'o //
translated: That means that drink is suitable for a certain time.🔽If it is different, it is the end of that.

original: gzhan nyid yin na de'i gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni btung ba'i rdzas de dus su rung ba las gzhan ba dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin na gang zhig rdzas de'i mthar thug pa btung ba de la thun tshod kyi mtha' gzhan bza' bar bya
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na de'i gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni btung ba'i rdzas de dus su rung ba las gzhan ba dus ma yin par rung ba nyid yin na gang zhig rdzas de'i mthar thug pa btung ba de la thun tshod kyi mtha' gzhan bza' bar bya
translated: If that drink is different from what is suitable for a certain time, it is suitable for a time other than the proper time.

original: ba la dus gang gi tshe bza' bar bya ba nyid skyes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bza' ba'i phyir dus ma yin par btung ba'i rdzas la dus thams cad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ba la dus gang gi tshe bza' bar bya ba nyid skyes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bza' ba'i phyir dus ma yin par btung ba'i rdzas la dus thams cad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: If one drinks that substance at the end of the watch, one should know that it is suitable for all times, because it is suitable for the time when it is to be eaten.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ni thun tshod du rung ba nyid yin par shas par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ni thun tshod du rung ba nyid yin par shas par bya'o //
translated: If it is blessed, it is to be understood as suitable for a certain time.

original: kha cig na re ma gyur na de yin gyi gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gang zhig btung ba'i rdzas kyi mtha' yin pa de nyid btung ba la zhes gang smos pa de gcig tu nges par rnam par gnas
analyzed: kha cig na re ma gyur na de yin gyi gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gang zhig btung ba'i rdzas kyi mtha' yin pa de nyid btung ba la zhes gang smos pa de gcig tu nges par rnam par gnas
translated: Some say: If it has not changed state, it is the end of that which is drunk. If it has changed state, it is the end of that which is drunk for as long as it has not changed state.

original: pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as not definitely remaining as stated,

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid ma gyur na de ltung ba'i mtha' yin gyi /🔽gyur na skad cig gang tshun chad kyi 'og tu ngo bo nyid @154a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid ma gyur na de ltung ba'i mtha' yin gyi / gyur na skad cig gang tshun chad kyi 'og tu ngo bo nyid @154a * //
translated: because if the essence has not changed state, it is the end of that which is drunk.

original: du gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid btung ba'i mtha' yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: du gyur pa'i skad cig de nyid btung ba'i mtha' yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: If it has changed state, the end of that which is drunk should be understood as the moment when the essence changes state.

original: de ni ma yin te dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de 'byung bar 'gyur ba phal pa rnams kyi bgrod pa ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ba ni /🔽de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de 'byung bar 'gyur ba phal pa rnams kyi bgrod pa ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gyur na gang tshun chad de yin pa'o zhes zer ba ni / de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because if it were dependent on a remaining period of time, it would not be a blessing, and because it would not be a blessing that is the domain of ordinary beings.

original: dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus lhag pa la brten na mi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: That is not so, because if it were dependent on a remaining period of time, it would not be a blessing.

original: gang las btung bar gyur par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang las btung bar gyur par 'gyur na /
translated: From what would it become a blessing?

original: de'i phyir dus lhag pa la byin gyis brlab pa brten pa'i byin gyis brlab pa mi 'chags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus lhag pa la byin gyis brlab pa brten pa'i byin gyis brlab pa mi 'chags pa ste /
translated: Therefore, a blessing dependent on a remaining period of time is not a blessing.

original: 'dir de tsam gyi dus las ma gnang ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir de tsam gyi dus las ma gnang ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di thob pa'o //
translated: Here, it is obtained because it is not permitted for that length of time.

original: thob pa de dang mi 'chags pa med pa la shes par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tha mal pa rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ma yin pa nyid thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa de dang mi 'chags pa med pa la shes par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tha mal pa rnams la byin gyis brlab pa ma yin pa nyid thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would follow that the consecration of ordinary people would not be possible, because they do not have that attainment and because they are not to be known.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni tha mal pa dang / ma thob pa rnams la ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa'i nus pas bgrod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni tha mal pa dang / ma thob pa rnams la ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa'i nus pas bgrod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because that which is to arise is ordinary, and the capacity of future cognition is not to be traversed by those who have not attained it.

original: de lta bas na de mi shes pa'i phyir yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i dus gang yin pa de mi shes pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na de mi shes pa'i phyir yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i dus gang yin pa de mi shes pas /
translated: Therefore, because that is not known, the time of retention is not known.

original: des na byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid btung ba la thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid btung ba la thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, consecration itself would be obtained in drinking.

original: thun tshod nyid kyis kyang mdun rol du thun tshod kyi tha ma las 'ga' zhig las yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun tshod nyid kyis kyang mdun rol du thun tshod kyi tha ma las 'ga' zhig las yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the moment itself, some would be retained from the end of the last moment in the future.

original: 'dir ro dang phye ma sbyar ba'i btung ba dag 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ro dang phye ma sbyar ba'i btung ba dag 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the drink mixed with powder and juice is indeed a combination.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni thun tshod du rung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni thun tshod du rung ba rnams la'o //
translated: Here means in the case of those that are suitable for one day.

original: ro dang phye ma sbyar ba'i btung ba la yang thun tshod du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro dang phye ma sbyar ba'i btung ba la yang thun tshod du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that one should know that drinks mixed with flavorings and powders are also suitable for one day.

original: sman rtsabs shin tu sla ba yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sman rtsabs shin tu sla ba yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, The same applies to very simple medicines.

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba dag tu 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba dag tu 'dus pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term the same means that they are included among the drinks that are suitable for one day.

original: sman rtsabs zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sman rtsabs zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the term simple medicines?

original: de'i phyir de ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman bkus pa skyur po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman bkus pa skyur po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To indicate this, the root text states, They are sour medicines that are made from roots and so on.

original: thun tshod du rung ba bstan nas ;
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba bstan nas ;
translated: Having explained the drinks that are suitable for one day,🔽the root text states,

original: de'i phyir zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi sbu ba dag ni zhag bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi sbu ba dag ni zhag bdun pa'o //
translated: The next verse addresses the question, What are the seven-day medicines?

original: bu ram dang hvags dang / li kha ra la sogs pa thams cad ni bu ram gyi sbu ba nyid kyis 'phangs so zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag glang bu lta bus dge slong zan chad pa rnams kyis dus ma lags par ci @154b zhig 'tshal du rung zhes zhus na /
analyzed: bu ram dang hvags dang / li kha ra la sogs pa thams cad ni bu ram gyi sbu ba nyid kyis 'phangs so zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag glang bu lta bus dge slong zan chad pa rnams kyis dus ma lags par ci @154b zhig 'tshal du rung zhes zhus na /
translated: All molasses, honey, and sugar cane products are thrown out by the mere presence of molasses scum.

original: bu ram dang / zhun mar dang / hvags dang / li kha ra dag dang / btung ba dag go zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de las 'di ltar shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bu ram dang / zhun mar dang / hvags dang / li kha ra dag dang / btung ba dag go zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de las 'di ltar shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is to be understood from the statement by the householder Ganda that when monks are hungry, what is proper to eat at the improper time is molasses, oil-seeds, honey, sugar cane products, and drinks.🔽The nectar is similar to oil-seeds.

original: bdud rtsi ni zhun mar dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba nyid dang zhag bdun pa nyid kyi phyir te ;
analyzed: bdud rtsi ni zhun mar dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba nyid dang zhag bdun pa nyid kyi phyir te ;
translated: This is because it is to be eaten and it lasts for seven days.

original: zhun mar gyi rnam pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ltar 'di smos te /
analyzed: zhun mar gyi rnam pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ltar 'di smos te /
translated: This is stated in order to indicate that it is a type of oil-seed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: zhu ba las so //
analyzed: zhu ba las so //
translated: It is produced from a boil.

original: zhag bskol zhing btsags pa dag ni 'bru mar dang mar 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: zhag bskol zhing btsags pa dag ni 'bru mar dang mar 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Boiled and strained, it is similar to oil and butter.

original: de'i tshe de rnams yin par byin len byas pa rnams ni 'bru mar gyi rnam pa nyid las skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams yin par byin len byas pa rnams ni 'bru mar gyi rnam pa nyid las skyes pa nyid do //
translated: At that time, the five types of oil are produced from the oil-cakes that have been consecrated.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: zhag rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni dus ma yin par bskol /🔽dus ma yin par btsags /
analyzed: zhag rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni dus ma yin par bskol / dus ma yin par btsags /
translated: “These five types of oil should not be consumed if they are boiled at the wrong time,🔽pressed at the wrong time,

original: dus ma yin par byin len byas /
analyzed: dus ma yin par byin len byas /
translated: consecrated at the wrong time,

original: dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang yongs su longs spyod par mi bya'o //
translated: or consecrated at the wrong time.

original: dus su bskol dus su btsags /
analyzed: dus su bskol dus su btsags /
translated: If they are boiled at the right time, pressed at the right time,

original: dus su byin len byas shing dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus su byin len byas shing dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs na yang longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: consecrated at the right time, but consecrated at the wrong time, they should not be consumed.

original: dus su bskol dus su btsags dus su byin len byas /
analyzed: dus su bskol dus su btsags dus su byin len byas /
translated: If they are boiled at the right time, pressed at the right time, consecrated at the right time,

original: dus su byin gyis brlabs na 'bru mar nyid du longs spyad pas zhag bdun pas yongs su longs spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus su byin gyis brlabs na 'bru mar nyid du longs spyad pas zhag bdun pas yongs su longs spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and consecrated at the right time, they should be consumed as oil for seven days.”

original: gang zhig 'dir bskol ba dang btsags pa nyid ni khas len par byed pa de bas na 'dir don 'di rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir bskol ba dang btsags pa nyid ni khas len par byed pa de bas na 'dir don 'di rnyed pa'o //
translated: Since it is accepted that what is boiled or strained here is to be eaten, the meaning here is this.

original: 'dir de dag la dus ma yin par byas pa nyid la bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir de dag la dus ma yin par byas pa nyid la bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, it should be understood that what is done at the wrong time is not to be eaten.

original: dus ma yin pa 'am dus 'di dag byas pa la dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs brlabs pa nyid la bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir don de'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa 'am dus 'di dag byas pa la dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs brlabs pa nyid la bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir don de'o //
translated: The meaning here is that what is done at the wrong time or at these times, consecrated as wrong time, is not to be eaten.

original: byin len byed pa la yang tshul 'di nyid do //
analyzed: byin len byed pa la yang tshul 'di nyid do //
translated: The same method applies to receiving.

original: 'dir gnas skabs dang 'brel ba'i bye brag ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gnas skabs dang 'brel ba'i bye brag ni 'di yin no //
translated: Here, this is the distinction related to the occasion.

original: byin len 'di la bskol ba dang / btsags pa ltar dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs pa la gnas skabs nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byin len 'di la bskol ba dang / btsags pa ltar dus ma yin par byin gyis brlabs pa la gnas skabs nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In this receiving, as with what is boiled or strained, there is no occasion for what is consecrated as the wrong time.

original: zhag rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs pa de dag la ni nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhag rnam pa lnga zhes gsungs pa de dag la ni nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those five types of days are not definite.

original: 'di rnams nyid la 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid yin nam 'on te 'dra ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid la 'bru mar dang 'dra ba nyid yin nam 'on te 'dra ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Are these just like sesame oil or not?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: To show this, the purpose is stated:

original: de'i phyir nya dang ri bong gi dang chu srin byis pa gsod kyi dang / dom gyi dang phag gi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nya dang ri bong gi dang chu srin byis pa gsod kyi dang / dom gyi dang phag gi'o //
translated: Therefore, of fish, rabbit, porpoise, bear, and pig.

original: de dag ni nad pa la phal cher @155a * //
analyzed: de dag ni nad pa la phal cher @155a * //
translated: These are mostly used for the sick.

original: sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni lan shin tu mang ba'o //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni lan shin tu mang ba'o //
translated: Mostly means very often.

original: rgyu des nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i na ba rnams la phal cher 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu des nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i na ba rnams la phal cher 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that reason, those who are sick are mostly cured by what is well known in the world.

original: sos pa nyid ni de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni de rnams la ni nad sos pas bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba de 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sos pa nyid ni de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni de rnams la ni nad sos pas bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba de 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: As for being cured, if they ask for it, it is given. This shows that they should not be made to use those things when they are cured.

original: de yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyis 'di rnams dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyis 'di rnams dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir rig par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that this is not in agreement with those, because of being such.

original: rgyu med par na ba zhes bya ba gang la zhag gis gnod pa'i nad de la snyam du shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par na ba zhes bya ba gang la zhag gis gnod pa'i nad de la snyam du shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word ill should be understood implicitly to mean one who is afflicted by an illness for which there is no cure.

original: dge slong gi tshig kyang 'dir 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi tshig kyang 'dir 'don pa yin te /
translated: The words of the monk are recited here:

original: gleng gzhi'i mtha' ma'i zhag la der mtshon par gyur pa smos par rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i mtha' ma'i zhag la der mtshon par gyur pa smos par rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: On the last day of the period, he should be taken there.

original: khyim pa nad pa la yang sbyin par rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyim pa nad pa la yang sbyin par rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is known that even a layperson who is ill should be given.

original: de bas na 'dir nye bar ma bsdus so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nye bar ma bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not included here.

original: de med na sman khang du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de med na sman khang du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not have that, then in the infirmary, means:

original: slong ba ni med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba ni med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If he does not have a caretaker, he should be placed in the Saṅgha's infirmary.

original: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be placed in the Saṅgha's infirmary.

original: sman khu dang mig sman dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sman khu dang mig sman dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Also eye medicine and eye ointment.

original: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba dang / de med na sman khang du gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no zhes bya ba dang / de med na sman khang du gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If they are fresh, they should be given to the sick.  And if they do not exist, they should be placed in the infirmary.

original: da ni bzhi pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bzhi pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the fourth should be explained.

original: de'i phyir 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba ni rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba ni rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, That which is to be kept until death is the root, the stem, the leaf, the flower, and the fruit, which are not used for food.

original: kha zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa de dag 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa de dag 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those which are not used for food are to be kept until death. This is the meaning.

original: de la rtsa ba dag gang zhe na 'di lta ste gla sgar dang shu dag dang / yung ba dang / sge'u gsher dang bong dkar po dag go //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba dag gang zhe na 'di lta ste gla sgar dang shu dag dang / yung ba dang / sge'u gsher dang bong dkar po dag go //
translated: Among them, what are the roots? They are turmeric, ginger, indigo, bamboo manna, and white aconite.

original: sdong bu dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdong bu dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the stems?

original: tsan dan dang / sbyi mo dang shug pa dang sre tres dang / thang shing dang skyer ba dag go //
analyzed: tsan dan dang / sbyi mo dang shug pa dang sre tres dang / thang shing dang skyer ba dag go //
translated: They are sandalwood, bamboo, willow, sleshmantaka, dhava, and jujube.

original: 'dab ma dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dab ma dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the leaves?

original: ba sha ka dang ko sha ta ki dang / pa to la dang ni ma ba dang / sapta parna'i 'dab ma dag go //
analyzed: ba sha ka dang ko sha ta ki dang / pa to la dang ni ma ba dang / sapta parna'i 'dab ma dag go //
translated: They are the leaves of the banyan tree, the kośataki, the patola, the nimba, and the saptaparṇa.

original: me tog dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: me tog dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the flowers?

original: me tog ni ba sha ka dang / nim pa dang / ha da ki dang / klu shing dang padma'i ze ba dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: me tog ni ba sha ka dang / nim pa dang / ha da ki dang / klu shing dang padma'i ze ba dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are the flowers of the banyan tree, the nimba, the hada, the nāga tree, and the lotus.

original: ze ba de dag kyang mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ze ba de dag kyang mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: These flowers are only examples.

original: me tog las phal cher sman zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan dag tha dad du byas nas bsdus pa'o //
