analyzed: rang rang gi cho ga 'di la 'jug par byar rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is suitable to engage in this rite of each one.🔽If molasses is placed in flour for the purpose of making molasses candy, it is established as just the number of days of the flour by washing.

original: bu ram bsgong ba'i phyir 'bras phye'i nang du gzhag pa ni bkru bas rang kho na'i grangs nyid du 'grub po zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bu ram bsgong ba'i phyir 'bras phye'i nang du gzhag pa ni bkru bas rang kho na'i grangs nyid du 'grub po zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is just seven days.🔽The essence of molasses should be understood as molasses.

original: 'gor gyi zungs ni bu ram nyid du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bu ram bskol ba'i dus su 'gor dang lings nyid du bya ba'i phyir 'bras kyi bag phye la sogs pa blugs pa de ni bu ram nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'gor gyi zungs ni bu ram nyid du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bu ram bskol ba'i dus su 'gor dang lings nyid du bya ba'i phyir 'bras kyi bag phye la sogs pa blugs pa de ni bu ram nyid yin pas /
translated: The meaning is that when molasses is boiled, flour and so on is added for the purpose of making molasses candy and molasses.

original: de la dus su rung ba nyid ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dus su rung ba nyid ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not suitable for the time.

original: de'i phyir de la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is taught for that.🔽It is said that there is no storing of what is consecrated.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa la ni gsog 'jog mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa la ni gsog 'jog mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the text is:

original: btsun pa bro 'tshal bas byin len bgyis pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su longs spyod du rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun pa bro 'tshal bas byin len bgyis pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su longs spyod du rung ngam /
translated: Venerable, is it suitable to enjoy what has been received and consecrated by one who is sick?

original: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gang zhig gsungs pa de bas na mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gang zhig gsungs pa de bas na mdo 'di byas so //
translated: Upāli, it is suitable. Thus, this sūtra was composed.

original: bro 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni na ba la rung ba nyid du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bro 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni na ba la rung ba nyid du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Here, sick is taught to be suitable for the sick.

original: nad pa'i ched du yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir rang gi dus kyi mtha'i bar du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad pa'i ched du yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir rang gi dus kyi mtha'i bar du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of the sick, it should be consecrated up to the end of one's own time for enjoyment.Here is the Sanskrit-English alignment based on the Japanese translations:

original: dus su rung ba'i ni de'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i ni de'i yul ma yin te /
translated: What is suitable for the time is not its object,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consecration would be meaningless.

original: thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag rang rang gi dus kyi mtha' chun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag rang rang gi dus kyi mtha' chun chad du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate the medicine that is to be taken for a watch, for seven days, or for life, until the end of the period.

original: dus gang gi tshe byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
translated: At what time should one consecrate it?

original: de'i phyir zas snga ma'i tshe'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zas snga ma'i tshe'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “at the time of the former meal.”

original: 'dir cho ga'i gzhir gyur pa zhes bya ba yin pas /🔽dus su bza' bar bya ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir cho ga'i gzhir gyur pa zhes bya ba yin pas / dus su bza' bar bya ba la brten pa'o //
translated: Here, it is the basis of the rite,🔽because it is based on the time of eating.

original: bza' bar bya ba'i dus 'di la gzhir gyur pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas de shes pa'o //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba'i dus 'di la gzhir gyur pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas de shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “at the time of eating” is the basis itself.

original: thun tshod kyi don las kyang 'di'i nges pa rnam par gnas pa byin gyis brlab pa med par phyis zas byin len byas pa la thun gcig gi mthar ji srid du rung ba nyid ces bya ba de nyid du 'di la don dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: thun tshod kyi don las kyang 'di'i nges pa rnam par gnas pa byin gyis brlab pa med par phyis zas byin len byas pa la thun gcig gi mthar ji srid du rung ba nyid ces bya ba de nyid du 'di la don dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The determination of this is established by the meaning of “watch.” Without consecration, the food that is received later is suitable for one watch.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: To what extent is it suitable?

original: de'i phyir byin len byas te'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byin len byas te'o //
translated: Therefore it is said, “after receiving it.”

original: byin @157b len ma byas pa dang gsog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byin @157b len ma byas pa dang gsog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: One should guard against taking without formal acceptance, storing, and mixing.

original: de'i phyir lag pa gnyis ka bsnyal nas so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lag pa gnyis ma bsnyal ba la byin len ma byas pa dang / gsog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lag pa gnyis ka bsnyal nas so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lag pa gnyis ma bsnyal ba la byin len ma byas pa dang / gsog 'jog dang 'dres pa bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “With both hands turned over,” because if both hands are not turned over, one should guard against taking without formal acceptance, storing, and mixing.

original: lag nyar blangs pa dang gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dag la byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la btsos pa'i sgras kyang nang du'i sgra dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa dang gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dag la byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la btsos pa'i sgras kyang nang du'i sgra dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is said that one should not confess taking with one’s own hand, storing, taking without formal acceptance, keeping overnight, cooking oneself, or cooking by a fully ordained monk. Here, the term “cooking” is also related to the term “overnight.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the question says:

original: nang du btsos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nang du btsos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Cooking overnight” and so on.

original: ro dang sla ba nyid yongs su gyur na ni gsog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ro mi snang ba nyid du yongs su gyur pa ni de'i tshe gsog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ro dang sla ba nyid yongs su gyur na ni gsog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ro mi snang ba nyid du yongs su gyur pa ni de'i tshe gsog 'jog byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the taste and softness change, then it is stored.

original: 'dir ni 'di gnyis kyi ni ngo bo nyid gyur par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di gnyis kyi ni ngo bo nyid gyur par bstan te /
translated: Here, the nature of these two is taught.

original: de bas na de gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are mentioned.

original: de lta bas na gcig la yang de las yongs su gyur na gsog 'jog nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig la yang de las yongs su gyur na gsog 'jog nyid do //
translated: Thus, if there is a change in either, it is stored.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las /
translated: Here, the text is scattered.

original: bu ram gyi btung ba'i skabs nas /
analyzed: bu ram gyi btung ba'i skabs nas /
translated: In the section on sugarcane juice,

original: btsun ba btung ba btsags nas dgung bdun bar byin gyis brlab tu rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun ba btung ba btsags nas dgung bdun bar byin gyis brlab tu rung ngam /
translated: “Is it permissible, O Venerable One, to consecrate filtered juice for seven days?”

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: “Upāli, it is not permissible.”

original: btsun ba yun ji srid cig tu gzhag par 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun ba yun ji srid cig tu gzhag par 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: “O Venerable One, for how long should it be kept?”

original: nye ba 'khor shin tu sla zhing mi skur la rang gi ngo bo nyid mi spong ba de srid du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor shin tu sla zhing mi skur la rang gi ngo bo nyid mi spong ba de srid du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, as long as it is very thin, not turbid, and does not lose its own nature.”

original: 'dir zhu ba bya ba ma yin pa nyid gsungs te /🔽'di la gsog 'jog las gzhan pa'i btung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid la rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa de bas na gsog 'jog nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhu ba bya ba ma yin pa nyid gsungs te / 'di la gsog 'jog las gzhan pa'i btung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid la rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa de bas na gsog 'jog nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: Here, it is said that it is not to be drunk.🔽Here, it is not to be drunk except in the case of hoarding and storing. The reason is that it does not remain in the stomach. Therefore, it should be understood as hoarding and storing.

original: byin gyis brlab pa 'og ma dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir bye brag tu bcad pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gsog 'jog gi dus la ma bab pa dang lhan cig ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa 'og ma dang lhan cig yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir bye brag tu bcad pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / gsog 'jog gi dus la ma bab pa dang lhan cig ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The consecration is not to be enjoyed together with the latter.  The latter means the consecration and the time of hoarding and storing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: mood gal gyi bu la thun tshod du rung ba gang yin pa dang / zhag bdun pa gang yin pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de dus su rung ba dang 'dres na yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu la thun tshod du rung ba gang yin pa dang / zhag bdun pa gang yin pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de dus su rung ba dang 'dres na yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Maudgalyāyana, what is suitable for a watch, what is suitable for seven days, and what is suitable for life, if mixed with what is suitable for a watch, should not be enjoyed.

original: zhag bdun ba gang yin pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de thun tshod du rung ba dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad @158a * //🔽par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun ba gang yin pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de thun tshod du rung ba dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad @158a * // par mi bya'o //
translated: If what is to be kept for seven days is mixed with what is to be kept for life, it should not be used.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de zhag bdun pa dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽sman gyi go rims ni dpe'o zhes bya ba ni sngar de ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes smos pas /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de zhag bdun pa dang 'dres na yang yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // sman gyi go rims ni dpe'o zhes bya ba ni sngar de ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes smos pas /
translated: If what is to be kept for life is mixed with what is to be kept for seven days, it should not be used.🔽The order of the medicines is merely an example.

original: sman rnam pa bzhi smos pa'i go rims de ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: sman rnam pa bzhi smos pa'i go rims de ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: The order in which the four types of medicine are mentioned is merely an example.

original: de bas na 'dis mig sman la sogs pa dag kyang ma 'phangs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis mig sman la sogs pa dag kyang ma 'phangs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, eye medicine, etc., are not excluded.

original: de bas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: de'i phyir mig sman bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig sman bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, eye medicine should be used.

original: sman ma yin pa'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgeg pa'i don ni sman ma yin pa'i don te de'i don du mig sman bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sman ma yin pa'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgeg pa'i don ni sman ma yin pa'i don te de'i don du mig sman bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: The meaning of collyrium is the meaning of non-medicine, so one should not use it for the purpose of eye ointment.

original: 'di ni dris byug pa dang kha dog 'chang ba'i phyogs nyid du dogs pa de bas na 'di spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dris byug pa dang kha dog 'chang ba'i phyogs nyid du dogs pa de bas na 'di spangs pa'o //
translated: This is the very position of applying ointment and wearing colors, so this is rejected.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo dag las mig thur bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo dag las mig thur bcang bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the text says, The eyes should be cast down,

original: ji snyed du rang 'khrungs dag go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji snyed du rang 'khrungs dag go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as much as one's own birth.

original: de'i snod rigs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i snod rigs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The vessel for that is appropriate, it says.

original: gang gi snod ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi snod ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the vessel for?

original: de'i phyir mig sman skyer khanda'i ni za ma tog go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig sman skyer khanda'i ni za ma tog go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, The vessel for collyrium is a box.

original: bcang bar bya ba nyid kyang de la sogs pa dang skyer khanda la sogs par don gyis rig par bya'o //🔽mig sman ri lu'i ni sge'u 'o //
analyzed: bcang bar bya ba nyid kyang de la sogs pa dang skyer khanda la sogs par don gyis rig par bya'o // mig sman ri lu'i ni sge'u 'o //
translated: The very fact of being worn should be understood by implication to be with that and so on, and with collyrium and so on.🔽The vessel for collyrium pills is a case.

original: mig sman du ba dang sbrus pa dang / phye ma rnams kyi ni dong bu'i thur ma bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig sman du ba dang sbrus pa dang / phye ma rnams kyi ni dong bu'i thur ma bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The vessel for collyrium smoke, paste, and powder should be worn as a tube.

original: zangs ma dang lcags dag gi bzang ngo //
analyzed: zangs ma dang lcags dag gi bzang ngo //
translated: and of copper and iron.

original: ci mig thur thams cad rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mig thur thams cad rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Are all kinds of eye-salve suitable?

original: de'i phyir rang 'khrungs dag go zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang 'khrungs dag go zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: “naturally produced.”

original: nad pas sman gzhug pa'i phyir mchan khug bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas sman gzhug pa'i phyir mchan khug bcang bar bya'o //
translated: In order to insert medicine for an illness, one should carry a case.

original: der ma shong ba nyid yin na brubs sam thum po byas te bcer ro shes bya ba la /
analyzed: der ma shong ba nyid yin na brubs sam thum po byas te bcer ro shes bya ba la /
translated: If it does not fit in there, one should make a roll or a ball and carry it in a case.

original: der zhes bya ba ni mtshan khug der brubs sam thum po byas te bcer ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni mtshan khug der brubs sam thum po byas te bcer ro //
translated: In there means in the case. One should make a roll or a ball and carry it in the case.🔽In order to prevent the inserted medicine from dissolving, one should dry it in the sun.

original: bcug pa mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir dus su skam mo zhes bya ba la gang du bskam par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bcug pa mi 'drul bar bya ba'i phyir dus su skam mo zhes bya ba la gang du bskam par bya zhe na /
translated: Where should one dry it?

original: de'i phyir nyi grib la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi grib la'o //
translated: Therefore he says: “in the shade of the sun.”🔽If it is dried, its potency is reduced.

original: bskams na mthu 'bri'o zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir bsgrub pa 'di bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: bskams na mthu 'bri'o zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir bsgrub pa 'di bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: gos la sogs pa bskam ba la yang cho ga 'di yin gyi de nyid la ni ma yin zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa bskam ba la yang cho ga 'di yin gyi de nyid la ni ma yin zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is the rule for drying cloth, etc., but not for that.

original: ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byung na rang gis brub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byung na rang gis brub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a cause of unfitness arises, one should dry it oneself.

original: rlung dang char ba la sogs pas sman ma rung bar gyur pa'i rgyu byung na de bskams pa'i gnas nas rang gis bsdu zhing brub par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang char ba la sogs pas sman ma rung bar gyur pa'i rgyu byung na de bskams pa'i gnas nas rang gis bsdu zhing brub par bya'o //
translated: If a cause of unfitness of medicine arises through wind, rain, etc., one should dry it oneself in a place where it is not drying.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad @158b du 'am zhe na /🔽de'i phyir bsnyen par rdzogs pa med na'o //
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad @158b du 'am zhe na / de'i phyir bsnyen par rdzogs pa med na'o //
translated: Is it in all circumstances?

original: sman phor bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sman phor bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, if there is no full ordination, one should carry a medicine bowl.

original: phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las /
translated: In the Ksudraka Collection,

original: 'dir dang por byas te phyis longs spyad pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang por byas te phyis longs spyad pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: it is concluded with Here, having first made it, one should later enjoy it.

original: sman gyi nal ze yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sman gyi nal ze yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Also, a medicine bag.

original: nad pas bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nad pas bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should carry it, one who is sick.🔽A drinking vessel offered by one who is unable to go.

original: 'gror mi btub pas phul ba'i btung phor ro zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gror mi btub pas phul ba'i btung phor ro zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should carry it.

original: 'gror mi btub pas zhes bya ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mid pa'i tshe nang du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gror mi btub pas zhes bya ba la 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mid pa'i tshe nang du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase unable to swallow means that when food is swallowed, it is unable to enter the throat.

original: mi btub pa zhes bya ba ni mid pa'i tshe nang du 'gror mi btub cing mgul bar thogs shing snang ba ste /
analyzed: mi btub pa zhes bya ba ni mid pa'i tshe nang du 'gror mi btub cing mgul bar thogs shing snang ba ste /
translated: The phrase unable to swallow means that when food is swallowed, it is unable to enter the throat and becomes stuck in the throat.

original: gang gis der 'gror mi btub pa de ni 'dir mgul pa'i nad ces bya ba'i don to //🔽phul ba'i btung phor zhes bya ba ni gang zas zos na mgul par thogs pa de 'phul bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis der 'gror mi btub pa de ni 'dir mgul pa'i nad ces bya ba'i don to // phul ba'i btung phor zhes bya ba ni gang zas zos na mgul par thogs pa de 'phul bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the phrase unable to swallow is that it is unable to enter the throat.

original: phyi nas skom 'thung bar byed pa'i snod chung du ma la bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas skom 'thung bar byed pa'i snod chung du ma la bya'o //
translated: The phrase drinking vessel refers to a small vessel used to drink water after eating, because it is used to drink water when the throat is obstructed by food.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gnas brtan khyod ci bsnyung /
analyzed: gnas brtan khyod ci bsnyung /
translated: Elder, are you sick?

original: tshe dang ldan ba 'gror mi btub ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan ba 'gror mi btub ba'o //
translated: Venerable one, I am unable to swallow.

original: khyod kyis sngon ci bgyis phul ba'i btung por bcangs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngon ci bgyis phul ba'i btung por bcangs so //
translated: What did you do before? You held a drinking vessel.

original: de ci'i phyir mi bcang /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir mi bcang /
translated: Why don't you hold it now?🔽The Blessed One did not allow it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de nas ji srid du bka' stsal pa /

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su skyes pas bza' bar bya ba ma yin ba nyid du smos pa gang yin pa de 'dis ma bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su skyes pas bza' bar bya ba ma yin ba nyid du smos pa gang yin pa de 'dis ma bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This refers to the case where the animal is killed for food because of a strong desire to eat its flesh.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa de nges na ni shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa de nges na ni shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: If he is certain about the thought, then he knows.

original: gal te yid gnyis su gyur na 'du shes pa ltar yid gnyis so snyam du nges pa'i phyir des 'di bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yid gnyis su gyur na 'du shes pa ltar yid gnyis so snyam du nges pa'i phyir des 'di bsdus pa'o //
translated: If he is uncertain, then he is uncertain about the perception, and this is included in the rule.

original: stag gi god ma'i sha mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stag gi god ma'i sha mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat the flesh of a tiger’s kill.

original: shar shes na za bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: shar shes na za bar mi bya'o //
translated: If one knows, one should not eat it.

original: 'di ni phran tshegs dag las dge slong dag stag ni rul sbed pa yin bas @160b de'i phyir dge slong gis stag gi god ma'i sha bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phran tshegs dag las dge slong dag stag ni rul sbed pa yin bas @160b de'i phyir dge slong gis stag gi god ma'i sha bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the Kṣudraka Collection, where it says, “Monks, since tigers are thieves, a monk should not eat the flesh of a tiger’s kill.”

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / klu rnams kyi mi bza'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / klu rnams kyi mi bza'o //
translated: One should not eat the flesh of elephants, horses, and nāgas.

original: mig gcig pa dang / wa dang / spre'u dang / shing rta mo dang / bya rog dang / bya rgod dang / chu skyar dang / khyi dang / bya khra dang / 'ug pa dang / de dag las gzhan ba'i bya mi ro za ba dag dang /
analyzed: mig gcig pa dang / wa dang / spre'u dang / shing rta mo dang / bya rog dang / bya rgod dang / chu skyar dang / khyi dang / bya khra dang / 'ug pa dang / de dag las gzhan ba'i bya mi ro za ba dag dang /
translated: One should not eat the flesh of one-eyed, fox, monkey, camel, crow, vulture, heron, dog, hawk, owl, or other birds that eat human flesh.

original: bya gar dang / pha bang dang / skyin gor dang / dre'u srin dang / srin bu rnams kyi yang mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya gar dang / pha bang dang / skyin gor dang / dre'u srin dang / srin bu rnams kyi yang mi bza'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat the flesh of garuḍas, peacocks, partridges, donkeys, mules, camels, or worms.

original: de dag gi sha yang shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sha yang shes na bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This means that if one knows that the flesh is from these, one should not eat it.

original: de las gzhan ba'i zhes bya ba ni gang du mi ro za ba'i bya sngar bstan pa de dag las gzhan pa'i la'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba'i zhes bya ba ni gang du mi ro za ba'i bya sngar bstan pa de dag las gzhan pa'i la'o //
translated: “Other than those” means other than those birds that eat human flesh that were mentioned above.

original: zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las /🔽srin bu rnams kyi tshil 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las / srin bu rnams kyi tshil 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
translated: In some recensions of the text, it says:🔽“Should one eat the fat of worms?

original: 'tshal bar mi bgyi /
analyzed: 'tshal bar mi bgyi /
translated: Or should one not eat it?”

original: bka' stsal pa bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Buddha said, “One should not eat it.”

original: nad dang bral ba'i phyir lus bsku bar ni bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nad dang bral ba'i phyir lus bsku bar ni bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that one should anoint the body in order to be free from illness.🔽The others, such as the hair, are mentioned in the Sutra Requested by the

analyzed: gzhan dang skya la sogs pa rnams ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las so //
translated: Bhikṣu.

analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sa'i bu dag las so //
translated: The rest are mentioned in the Sutra Requested by the Sons of the Earth.🔽It should be asked, “Is the meat of humans and so on not obtained🔽through killing?” This means that it should be asked, “Is the meat of humans

original: sha'i byin len stobs pa la bcad pa las byung ba nyid ma yin nam zhes dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'i sha bcad pa gang yin pa de byung ba nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba dang / bcas par dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sha'i byin len stobs pa la bcad pa las byung ba nyid ma yin nam zhes dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi la sogs pa'i sha bcad pa gang yin pa de byung ba nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba dang / bcas par dri bar bya'o //
translated: and so on not obtained through killing?”

original: de mi la sogs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de mi la sogs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “Is it not the meat of humans and so on?”🔽If there are many, it is the first. If there are many eaters, it is the first that

original: du ma nyid yin na dang pos so zhes bya ba dang / za ba po du ma nyid yod na dang pos dri bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na dang pos so zhes bya ba dang / za ba po du ma nyid yod na dang pos dri bar bya ba ste /
translated: should be asked.

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi chos nyid kyis gsungs pa de 'dir rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the rule for the elder of the saṅgha, and it is the rule here.

original: de bas na de ltar nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is applied in this way.

original: nyams na 'og mas so zhes bya ba ni sha'i skabs dri'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: nyams na 'og mas so zhes bya ba ni sha'i skabs dri'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one violates the first, one should use the second.

original: dang pos dri ba nyams na 'og mas dri bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang pos dri ba nyams na 'og mas dri bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one violates the first, one should use the second.🔽One should not drink the milk of an elephant or a human.

original: glang po che dang mi'i 'o ma dag btung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni glang po che zhes bya ba gzhan du rigs tsam po'i gtso bo la brten nas mo'i rkyen ma bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: glang po che dang mi'i 'o ma dag btung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni glang po che zhes bya ba gzhan du rigs tsam po'i gtso bo la brten nas mo'i rkyen ma bskyed pa ste /
translated: The word “elephant” is a mere class name, not a feminine affix.

original: de lta bu'i sbyor ba yang mthong ste rigs kyi'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyor ba yang mthong ste rigs kyi'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Such usage is seen, like “of a class.”🔽In some manuscripts of the Questions of Upāli,

original: zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las /
analyzed: zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las /
translated: it says:

analyzed: btsun pa glang mo'i 'o ma 'am zho longs spyad du rung ngam /
translated: “Venerable, is it permissible to consume the milk or yogurt of an elephant?”

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: “Upāli, it is not permissible.”

original: gang zhig longs spyod par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig longs spyod par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “If one consumes it, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a minor offense.”

original: gzhan du mi'i bud med kyi 'o ma btung du rung ngam mi rung /🔽bka' @161a * //
analyzed: gzhan du mi'i bud med kyi 'o ma btung du rung ngam mi rung / bka' @161a * //
translated: “Is it permissible or not to drink the milk of a human woman?”🔽“It is not permissible.”

original: stsal pa / mi rung ngo /
analyzed: stsal pa / mi rung ngo /
translated: The Jetsun replied, That is not possible.🔽🔽

original: 'on kyang lus la bsku bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de gnyis ka bsdus nas smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus la bsku bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de gnyis ka bsdus nas smos pa yin no //
translated: Both of these are mentioned in the above passage.

original: pags pa dang rmar bsku ba dang snar blugs pa dang / mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la ni skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dag gis pags pa skud pa dang / rma skud pa dang / snar blugs pa dang mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la ni skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pags pa dang rmar bsku ba dang snar blugs pa dang / mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la ni skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dag gis pags pa skud pa dang / rma skud pa dang / snar blugs pa dang mig skud cing bza' btung mi byed pa la ni skyon chags pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no offense if one applies it to the skin, to a wound, or to the nose, or if one applies it to the eyes, but does not eat or drink.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is as follows:🔽In the Questions of the Brahmin Girl of the Kaushika clan,

original: dge srong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: dge srong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: it says:

original: btsun ba sman rung ba ma lags pa dag dang bskol ba'i 'bru mar 'tshal du rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: btsun ba sman rung ba ma lags pa dag dang bskol ba'i 'bru mar 'tshal du rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: “Venerable One, is it permissible to drink oil that is cooked with unallowable medicines?

original: lus skud pa de dang ; rma'i bsku mnye bya ba dang / snar ldugs pa'i las bya ba ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lus skud pa de dang ; rma'i bsku mnye bya ba dang / snar ldugs pa'i las bya ba ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one applies it to the body, to a wound, or to the nose, or if one applies it to the eyes, but does not eat or drink.

original: btsun ba bud med kyi 'o ma 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun ba bud med kyi 'o ma 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: Venerable One, is it permissible to drink the milk of a woman?

original: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: Upāli, it is not proper.

original: mig la skud pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la skud pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense if one ties a string to the eye.

original: lus skud pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lus skud pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one ties a string to the body.

original: sngar zhu ba las gsungs so //
analyzed: sngar zhu ba las gsungs so //
translated: This was stated in the Questions of Upāli.

original: nad pas ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar chang dang 'dres pa btung bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: nad pas ni zhun mar dang 'bru mar chang dang 'dres pa btung bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The sick may drink clarified butter, oil, and alcohol mixed with alcohol.

original: chang ma yin pa nyid ni nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chang ma yin pa nyid ni nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no offense if it is not alcohol.

original: nad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir btung ba po'i yul la zhu ba las /
analyzed: nad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir btung ba po'i yul la zhu ba las /
translated: Here, “the sick” refers to the person who is drinking.

original: 'di ni dang po ste bskol na rung ngo zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste bskol na rung ngo zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: “The first” refers to the beginning, up to “it is proper to drink when it is boiled.”

original: chang ma yin pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni chang ma yin pa nyid du gyur na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chang ma yin pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni chang ma yin pa nyid du gyur na nyes pa med do //
translated: “If it is not alcohol” means if it is not alcohol, there is no offense.

original: btung du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btung du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means it is not improper to drink.

original: de'i dri dang ro dag kyang gang du bral ba nyid de ni 'dir chang ma yin pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dri dang ro dag kyang gang du bral ba nyid de ni 'dir chang ma yin pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Here, “alcohol” refers to that which has the smell and taste of alcohol, and when it is separated from that, it is said to be not alcohol.

original: de'i phyir chang gi dri dang ro myang ba myos par mi byed pa dag ces gsungs pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chang gi dri dang ro myang ba myos par mi byed pa dag ces gsungs pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the words “the smell and taste of alcohol do not intoxicate” were spoken by the Buddha.

original: de ni bskol ba las 'grub po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni bskol ba las 'grub po zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is established by boiling.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la ni chad ma yin pa nyid de ni bskol ba las chang ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la ni chad ma yin pa nyid de ni bskol ba las chang ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ It” refers to the non-intoxicating nature of alcohol. The meaning is that alcohol becomes non-intoxicating through boiling.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the scripture:

original: btsun ba myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba zhugs kyis bskol nas 'tshal du rung ngam nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun ba myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba zhugs kyis bskol nas 'tshal du rung ngam nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Venerable One, is it permissible to drink alcohol that has been boiled with water?” “Upāli, it is permissible.”

original: gos kyi gzhi las smos pa'i tsha nyid du sgrub par byad pa'i chang gi cho ga brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gos kyi gzhi las smos pa'i tsha nyid du sgrub par byad pa'i chang gi cho ga brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the nature of alcohol mentioned in the chapter on robes, the ritual of alcohol is described.

original: de ni nas rngos pas gdab cing sa'i steng du bcug pa tsha nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nas rngos pas gdab cing sa'i steng du bcug pa tsha nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes non-intoxicating when barley flour is added and placed on the ground.

original: rgun gyi khu ba ni bskol na chang nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: rgun gyi khu ba ni bskol na chang nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Grape juice does not become alcohol when boiled. Here is the scripture:

original: bskol te gzhag par bya zhing dge 'dun gyi dus ma yin pa'i btung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs @161b ba'i dgongs pa la 'di smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bskol te gzhag par bya zhing dge 'dun gyi dus ma yin pa'i btung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs @161b ba'i dgongs pa la 'di smos pa yin no //
translated: This is the intended meaning of the above statement.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid la ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig tha dad pa ma yin pa de ni tha mi dad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid la ni yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig tha dad pa ma yin pa de ni tha mi dad par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that what is not different exists.

original: dper na til rnams la til mar dang / bu ram shing la khu ba dang / de la yang bu ram yod pa nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //🔽de lta bas na til la byin len byas pas til mar la byin len byas par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na til rnams la til mar dang / bu ram shing la khu ba dang / de la yang bu ram yod pa nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o // de lta bas na til la byin len byas pas til mar la byin len byas par mi 'gyur la /
translated: For example, it is not the case that sesame oil exists in sesame seeds, juice exists in sugarcane, or molasses exists in juice.🔽Therefore, one should understand that when one accepts sesame seeds, one does not accept sesame oil,

original: bu ram shing la byin len byas pas bur ma byin len byas par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bu ram shing la byin len byas pas bur ma byin len byas par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: and when one accepts sugarcane, one does not accept molasses.

original: bag chags su gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bag chags su gyur pa nyid ni yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But the existence of latent impressions is accepted.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: zhag rung ba ma lags pa dag bskol ba'i dbon tsha 'tshal du rung ngam mi rung bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhag rung ba ma lags pa dag bskol ba'i dbon tsha 'tshal du rung ngam mi rung bka' stsal pa /
translated: Is it permissible to eat the boiled essence of the bones of animals not to be killed, or not?

original: nad pas ni bzang rung la min pas ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nad pas ni bzang rung la min pas ni mi rung ngo //
translated: He said, “It is permissible for the sick, but not for those not sick.”

original: sha la yang de bzhin no zhes gang zhig zhus pa las rdzas rung ba ma yin pa dang 'bags pa bza' bar bya ba nyid ma yin zhes gsungs pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sha la yang de bzhin no zhes gang zhig zhus pa las rdzas rung ba ma yin pa dang 'bags pa bza' bar bya ba nyid ma yin zhes gsungs pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: “The same is true of meat.” This is what was asked, and it was said, “It is not to be eaten if it is not a suitable substance or if it is defiled.” This is included here.

original: chang gi srid pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba dang ; sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i sman skam po'i phye ma chang gi dris bsgos pa chu dang sbyar ba btung ngo zhes bya ba ni chang gi dris bsgos pa'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman rnams la skam po'i phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus so //
analyzed: chang gi srid pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rtsa ba dang ; sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu'i sman skam po'i phye ma chang gi dris bsgos pa chu dang sbyar ba btung ngo zhes bya ba ni chang gi dris bsgos pa'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sman rnams la skam po'i phye ma dang sbyar ba'i chus so //
translated: In order to remove the possibility of alcohol, one should drink a decoction of the powder of dry medicinal roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits, mixed with water, which is perfumed with alcohol. This means that one should drink water mixed with the powder of dry medicinal roots, etc., which are perfumed with alcohol.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: sil bu dag las /
analyzed: sil bu dag las /
translated: From the scattered texts:

original: de lta bas na chang du rung ba'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i rdzas skam po gang dag yin pa de dag phye mar byas te /🔽ras ma dkar pos phul te chang gi shugs dang bral ba'i snod ma gang bar bcang bar bya zhing de nas phyung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na chang du rung ba'i rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i rdzas skam po gang dag yin pa de dag phye mar byas te / ras ma dkar pos phul te chang gi shugs dang bral ba'i snod ma gang bar bcang bar bya zhing de nas phyung ste /
translated: Therefore, one should grind the roots, stems, etc. of any substance suitable for beer into powder,🔽wrap it in a white cloth, and carry it in a vessel that is not filled to the brim, free from the potency of beer.

original: byi dor byas nas zas dang ma 'bags pa'i chu dang lhan cig sbyar zhing btsags te btung bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byi dor byas nas zas dang ma 'bags pa'i chu dang lhan cig sbyar zhing btsags te btung bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then, having removed it, cleaned it, and mixed it with water that is not mixed with food, one should drink it after straining it.

original: chang dang bcas pa'i snod du sbyangs te gzhag bar bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: chang dang bcas pa'i snod du sbyangs te gzhag bar bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: One should be instructed to keep it in a vessel that is not mixed with beer.

original: reg pa bsrung ngo zhes bya ba ni phye ma'i phur ma de chang dang reg par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa bsrung ngo zhes bya ba ni phye ma'i phur ma de chang dang reg par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: One should protect it from contact means that one should protect the bag of powder so that it does not come into contact with beer.

original: de'i phyir ma gang ba dang shugs dang bral ba nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni chang gis ma gang ba'i snod dang bcas pa la chang gi shugs dang bral ba nyid ni de'i snod du gtogs pa'i chang la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma gang ba dang shugs dang bral ba nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni chang gis ma gang ba'i snod dang bcas pa la chang gi shugs dang bral ba nyid ni de'i snod du gtogs pa'i chang la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not filled and is free from the potency of alcohol.

original: gzhan du na gyen du btung bas reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du ro med par byed pa dang / dus ma yin bar btung ba la zas dang yang ngo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phye ma chang dang rag pa bsrung @162a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na gyen du btung bas reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de bzhin du ro med par byed pa dang / dus ma yin bar btung ba la zas dang yang ngo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phye ma chang dang rag pa bsrung @162a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would be touched by drinking it.🔽Similarly, it is said that it is food and drink that are free from taste and are drunk at the wrong time.

original: ba de bzhin du ro med par gyur pa'i rdzas kyis kyang dus ma yin par btung bar 'dod pa'i zas dang reg pa bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba de bzhin du ro med par gyur pa'i rdzas kyis kyang dus ma yin par btung bar 'dod pa'i zas dang reg pa bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Just as flour and alcohol are protected, so too should food and drink that are free from taste and drunk at the wrong time be protected.🔽It is also good to be beautiful.

original: mdzes pa yang bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni phye ma skam po chang gi dris bsgos pa dang sbyar ba'i chu bzang ba'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa yang bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni phye ma skam po chang gi dris bsgos pa dang sbyar ba'i chu bzang ba'o //
translated: It is good to drink water mixed with dry flour that is perfumed with the smell of alcohol.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bsrung bar bya ba nyid mdzes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bsrung bar bya ba nyid mdzes pa yin te /
translated: Because it is good to be protected in that way.

original: de'i phyir ras ma dkar pos btsags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ras ma dkar pos btsags par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be filtered with a white cloth.

original: nad pas chang ni rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad gnang ba'i yul la rjes su gnang ba de ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: nad pas chang ni rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa thams cad gnang ba'i yul la rjes su gnang ba de ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: A sick person should not drink alcohol even with kuśa grass. This is a special case that permits all proscribed offenses in the context of permission.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya na bar gyur pa dag la de nyid ma gnang bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'akya na bar gyur pa dag la de nyid ma gnang bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the Blessed One did not allow that very thing for the sick Śākyas, he said,

original: de ltar dge slong dag nga la ston ba zhes zer ba khyed cag gi tshang rtsva mchog gis kyang mi blud mi btung ngo zhes gsungs pa de bas mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong dag nga la ston ba zhes zer ba khyed cag gi tshang rtsva mchog gis kyang mi blud mi btung ngo zhes gsungs pa de bas mdo 'di byas so //
translated: You who say 'The monk is my teacher,' should not drink alcohol even with kuśa grass. Thus, this sūtra was composed.

original: dge bsnyen yan chad kyis mi blud cing zhes bya ba ni 'dir yan chad kyi sgra bris par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: dge bsnyen yan chad kyis mi blud cing zhes bya ba ni 'dir yan chad kyi sgra bris par rig par bya'o//
translated: Up to the lay follower should not pour means that the word up to should be written here.

original: dge bsnyen gyi mtha' yan chad chos 'di pa bslab pa ma blangs pa thams cad kyis kyang chang blud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi mtha' yan chad chos 'di pa bslab pa ma blangs pa thams cad kyis kyang chang blud par mi bya'o //
translated: Up to the lay follower, all who have not taken the training in this Dharma should not pour alcohol.

original: dge bsnyen gyis mi bya ba'i las drug ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyis mi bya ba'i las drug ste /
translated: The six actions that lay followers should not do are

original: sems can 'tshong ba dang / chang 'tshong ba dang / mtshon cha 'tshong ba dang / dug 'tshong ba dang / rgya skyegs kyi las dang / til 'tshong pa'i las so zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can 'tshong ba dang / chang 'tshong ba dang / mtshon cha 'tshong ba dang / dug 'tshong ba dang / rgya skyegs kyi las dang / til 'tshong pa'i las so zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: selling living beings, selling liquor, selling weapons, selling poison, running a place for prostitution, and running a place for the slaughter of animals.

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las gzhan pa thams cad la gso ba'i don nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa bza' ba thams cad bkag pa las gzhan
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa las gzhan pa thams cad la gso ba'i don nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa bza' ba thams cad bkag pa las gzhan
translated: The remainder is that all actions other than those that are naturally reprehensible are prohibited except for the purpose of curing.

original: du yang dgag pa'i phyir gang yin pa de thams cad la gsol ba'i don nyid du ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i lhag ma 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: du yang dgag pa'i phyir gang yin pa de thams cad la gsol ba'i don nyid du ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i lhag ma 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: The remainder is that all actions other than those that are prohibited by the Buddha are prohibited except for the purpose of curing.

original: phran tshegs dag las 'di dang por byas te gtsang bar byas pa dang spos kyis bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las 'di dang por byas te gtsang bar byas pa dang spos kyis bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The Ksudraka Collection states that this is the first of the rules for the pure life and concludes with the statement that one should anoint oneself with fragrant oils.

original: sgog skya dang kun dong ke'u bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sgog skya dang kun dong ke'u bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat garlic, asafoetida, or onions.

original: nad pas ni dben ba'i phyogs su'o zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba'o //🔽zos nas sgog skya ni zhag bdun /🔽kun dong ni zhag gsum /
analyzed: nad pas ni dben ba'i phyogs su'o zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba'o // zos nas sgog skya ni zhag bdun / kun dong ni zhag gsum /
translated: If one is sick, one should do so in a secluded place.

original: ke'u ni zhag gcig ma lon par gtsug lag khang du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽zos nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽sgog skya zos nas ni zhag bdun no //
analyzed: ke'u ni zhag gcig ma lon par gtsug lag khang du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / zos nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro // sgog skya zos nas ni zhag bdun no //
translated: After eating garlic, one should not enter the monastery for seven days.

original: de bzhin du kun dong zos @162b nas ni zhag gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun dong zos @162b nas ni zhag gsum mo //
translated: After eating asafoetida, for three days.

original: ke'u zos nas ni zhag gcig go //
analyzed: ke'u zos nas ni zhag gcig go //
translated: After eating onions, for one day.🔽The text continues:

original: gnas mal la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni longs spyad par mi bya'o //🔽bshang ba'i sar 'jug par mi bya'o //🔽gci ba'i sar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mal la mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni longs spyad par mi bya'o // bshang ba'i sar 'jug par mi bya'o // gci ba'i sar mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not use a bed or seat.🔽One should not enter the restroom.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not enter the urinal.🔽One should not enter the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: mchod rten gyi nyen kor du mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nyen kor du mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go near a stūpa.

original: de'i thag ni 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi nyen kor de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i thag ni 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi nyen kor de'i 'o //
translated: The distance is one fathom.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text continues:🔽“One should not go near a stūpa.

original: mchod rten gyi nyen kor 'dom gang spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi nyen kor 'dom gang spang bar bya ste /

original: dge slong dag mchod rten ni lha mngon bar dad pa can dag gis kun nas gang ba yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag mchod rten ni lha mngon bar dad pa can dag gis kun nas gang ba yin la /
translated: Monks, stupas are filled with gods who have faith in the gods.

original: lha rnams ni gtsang sbra 'dod pa yin pas dri de ni de dag dang mi mthun pa'i phyir mchod rten la phyag mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams ni gtsang sbra 'dod pa yin pas dri de ni de dag dang mi mthun pa'i phyir mchod rten la phyag mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since gods desire purity, the smell of a monk is not suitable for them, so one should not bow down to a stupa.

original: 'di ni mi rigs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs par gyur pa ste /
translated: This is unreasonable.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs rnams la mchod rten la phyag bya bar mi rigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs rnams la mchod rten la phyag bya bar mi rigs pa kho na yin no //

original: khyim bdag dag la chos bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag dag la chos bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not teach Dharma to householders.

original: khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to their homes.

original: skye bos gang ba'i sa phyogs su mi bya'o //
analyzed: skye bos gang ba'i sa phyogs su mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to places where people gather.

original: mjug tu khrus bya'o //
analyzed: mjug tu khrus bya'o //
translated: One should wash at the end.

original: gos dag gi dri ni bkru ba dang / du ba dag gis bsal lo //
analyzed: gos dag gi dri ni bkru ba dang / du ba dag gis bsal lo //
translated: The smell of clothes is removed by washing and smoke.

analyzed: rung ba nyid du byin gyis brlabs par btsos pa dang gnas pa dag ni phyi rol dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dper na dge slong gis gnas nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa nas phyi rol du gyur pa'i btsos pa dang gnas pa dag gis zas la
translated: For example, a bhikṣu goes to the external consecrated food and drink from the residence and the surrounding area of one fathom,

analyzed: der yang nyes pa de dag mi 'byung ba nyid byin gyis brlabs pa las gsungs so //
translated: And it is said that the consecration is that the faults do not occur there.🔽It is not suitable to do this.

analyzed: 'di byed par rigs pa ma yin pa 'am / 'on te yin snyam pa de bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya'o //

translated: One should not do it in a cave, in a place of dispute, in a place of oppression, in a house, in a courtyard, or in a place of bad meaning or disrespect.

analyzed: cig las bla gab med pa dang / me khang dang / mchod rten gyi gzhi dang / khyim bdag gi sa gzhi yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One is the open air, the second is a fire hut, the third is the base of a stupa, and the fourth is the ground of a householder.🔽

analyzed: der g-yos dang btso ba yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni shing drung la sogs pa dang bla gab med pa der ro //
translated: One should not cook or prepare food there means that one should not do these things at a tree root, etc., or in the open.

original: kun du spyod pa 'di ni khyim pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa 'di ni khyim pa dang 'dra ba ste /

original: g-yos dang btso ba byed pa de'i phyir shin tu dpen par 'di bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yos dang btso ba byed pa de'i phyir shin tu dpen par 'di bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Because they prepare and cook food, it is appropriate for them to do this in a secluded place.

original: 'dir ma sbas par gnas pas mi bya bar rab tu byung ba'i pham par gyur ba'i don 'dis gzhan rnams la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ma sbas par gnas pas mi bya bar rab tu byung ba'i pham par gyur ba'i don 'dis gzhan rnams la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, one should not do this in an open place, because this is the meaning of the defeat of a renunciate. This also applies to the other precepts.

original: shing drung la sogs pa rnams la 'di shin tu ma sbas pa nyid dang / gus pa nyams pa'i mtha' ma can gyi nyes pa rnams la 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba las g-yos pa dang btso ba dag las 'di rnams bkag pa dang / tshos pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: shing drung la sogs pa rnams la 'di shin tu ma sbas pa nyid dang / gus pa nyams pa'i mtha' ma can gyi nyes pa rnams la 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba las g-yos pa dang btso ba dag las 'di rnams bkag pa dang / tshos pa'i byi dor yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
translated: In regard to the faults of not being very hidden under trees, etc., and of being the end of the loss of respect, it is said, “in some places,” and in regard to cooking and boiling, it is said, “these are prohibited, and one should not do the cleaning of the cooked.”

original: tshos pa'i byi dor ni tshos pa'i byi dor ro //
analyzed: tshos pa'i byi dor ni tshos pa'i byi dor ro //
translated: The cleaning of the cooked is the cleaning of the cooked.

original: de mi bya ba sum cha bangs pan tshos pa yin te /
analyzed: de mi bya ba sum cha bangs pan tshos pa yin te /
translated: That is not to be done. One third of the cooked is the cooked.

original: tshos pa de dag dge slong rang gis byi dor bya ba ni shing drung la sogs pa'i gnas de rnams su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshos pa de dag dge slong rang gis byi dor bya ba ni shing drung la sogs pa'i gnas de rnams su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cleaning of the cooked by the monk himself is not to be done in those places under trees, etc.

original: de ni klog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni klog pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reading,

original: shin tu sdig pa bsrung ba la sogs pa de lta bas na nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sdig pa bsrung ba la sogs pa de lta bas na nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: but rather it is a summary of the very sinful protection, etc.

original: 'di la dus bzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab pa 'di la dus bzhi yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dus bzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab pa 'di la dus bzhi yod pa'o //
translated: It is said, “There are four times for this,” and the meaning is that there are four times for this consecration of a suitable house.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: dang po so phag 'grems pa'o //
analyzed: dang po so phag 'grems pa'o //
translated: First, the laying out of the bricks.🔽Later, the consecration of the suitable house, and the presence of the new work.

original: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni dang po so phag bkram pa'i 'og tu rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab pa ni dus gcig go //
analyzed: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni dang po so phag bkram pa'i 'og tu rung ba'i khang pa byin gyis brlab pa ni dus gcig go //
translated: The first is the laying out of the bricks.🔽Later, the consecration of the suitable house is at the same time.🔽The first is the laying out of the bricks.

original: dang po so phag bkram pa'i 'og tu deng phyin chad nas ji srid du las sar pa yod pa nyid 'di ni gzhan no //
analyzed: dang po so phag bkram pa'i 'og tu deng phyin chad nas ji srid du las sar pa yod pa nyid 'di ni gzhan no //
translated: Later, from now on, as long as the presence of the new work exists, this is different.🔽At another time, the presence of the monk himself.

original: gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba 'di la yod pas na 'di ni dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba 'di la yod pas na 'di ni dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: This is because it exists in the presence of the monk himself.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: This is the presence of the monk himself.

original: de las sar pa nyid kyi phyir dus gzhan gyi tshe na gal te dge slong rnams kyis lhag par gnas pa dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de las sar pa nyid kyi phyir dus gzhan gyi tshe na gal te dge slong rnams kyis lhag par gnas pa dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur na /
translated: Because of the presence of the new work, at another time, if the monks do not separate from the presence,

original: de nas byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ces bya ba 'di ni dus gsum pa'o //🔽de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa na @163b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid ces bya ba 'di ni dus gsum pa'o // de dag med pa na gnas pa'i phyir dge slong dag phyin pa na @163b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the fourth time is called the time of consecration.🔽When they are not present, the monks have arrived.

original: de na dge slong sngar gnas pa gnas khang na med pa de ni de ma yin pa de gang yin pa de la dge slong gnas pa med par gyur pa la lhag par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de na dge slong sngar gnas pa gnas khang na med pa de ni de ma yin pa de gang yin pa de la dge slong gnas pa med par gyur pa la lhag par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The monks who were previously present in the dwelling are not there. When the monks who are not present have arrived, the consecration is performed because the monks who were present have departed.

original: dge slong rnams kyis phyin pa gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i dus bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis phyin pa gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i dus bzhi pa'o //
translated: The time when the monks have arrived is the fourth time of consecration.

original: phyin pa'i dus de nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyin pa'i dus de nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The consecration should be performed at that very time when the monks have arrived.

original: bya ba gzhan brtsams pa dang ngal bso ba ma byas pa tshun chad ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni ji srid du de rnams phyin pa bya ba gzhan brtsams pa ma byas pa tshun chad zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan brtsams pa dang ngal bso ba ma byas pa tshun chad ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni ji srid du de rnams phyin pa bya ba gzhan brtsams pa ma byas pa tshun chad zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as they have not begun another activity or taken a break, it is the same. As long as they have not begun another activity, they have not departed.

original: 'dug pa la sogs pa gnas par gyur pa re zhig brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dug pa la sogs pa gnas par gyur pa re zhig brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: Sitting and so on are not considered to be dwelling.

original: de nyid ni phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni phyin pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is the perfection.

original: phyin ba'i gnas skabs su rig par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ba'i gnas skabs su rig par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it should be known as the state of having gone.

original: thams cad la dge 'dun gyi las kyis so zhes bya ba ni dus bzhi po de rnams la dge 'dun gyi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la dge 'dun gyi las kyis so zhes bya ba ni dus bzhi po de rnams la dge 'dun gyi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: In all cases, by the act of the Saṅgha. The meaning is: in those four times, it should be consecrated by the act of the Saṅgha.

original: dang po gnyis la ni gang zag gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dang po so phag 'grems par gyur pa dang / phyis las sar pa dang bcas par gyur pa nyid ni gang zag gis kyang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis la ni gang zag gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dang po so phag 'grems par gyur pa dang / phyis las sar pa dang bcas par gyur pa nyid ni gang zag gis kyang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: In the first two, also by an individual. The meaning is: in the first, when the bricks are being laid out, and later, when the work is finished, it should be consecrated also by an individual.

original: gang zag ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: gang zag ji lta bus she na /
translated: By what kind of individual?

original: de'i phyir lag gi blas so //🔽dang po shos la ni 'ba' zhig gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lag gi blas so // dang po shos la ni 'ba' zhig gis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says: by a master of ceremonies.🔽In the first, also by a single person.

original: dang po'i dus la dang po'i so phag 'grems pa nyid na lag gi bla 'ba' zhig gis kyang byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: dang po'i dus la dang po'i so phag 'grems pa nyid na lag gi bla 'ba' zhig gis kyang byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'o //
translated: The meaning is: in the first time, when the bricks are being laid out for the first time, it is suitable to consecrate by a single master of ceremonies.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po rnams kyis sems bsdu ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'di'i sngags ni /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po rnams kyis sems bsdu ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'di'i sngags ni /
translated: Not only do many monks gather their minds, but also the mantra of this is:

original: tshe dang ldan bdag sems sdus shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan bdag sems sdus shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Venerable one, gather your mind! This is the meaning of the words.

original: dang por 'ba' zhig la 'dis ji ltar byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dang por 'ba' zhig la 'dis ji ltar byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
translated: First, how is this blessed?

original: de'i phyir brjod pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: by speaking.

original: ji ltar yang de dge slong lag gi blas rdo brteg pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang de dge slong lag gi blas rdo brteg pa na /
translated: Just as when a monk who is a master of construction places a stone,

original: de'i phyir dang por gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur ba'i snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur ba'i snyam du sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, first, one should generate the thought This foundation will become a suitable dwelling for the Saṅgha and also speak those words.

original: gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This foundation will become a suitable dwelling for the Saṅgha.

original: gnyis pa la ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis sems bsdus bas so zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis sems bsdus bas so zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i dus gnyis pa ste /
translated: In the second, by many monks gathering their minds. This is the second time of blessing.

original: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i dus der ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis rung ba'i khang par sems bsdus par byin gyis brlab par bya ba ste /🔽de'i tshe na yang gtsug lag @164a * //
analyzed: phyis las sar pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i dus der ni dge slong rab tu mang po dag gis rung ba'i khang par sems bsdus par byin gyis brlab par bya ba ste / de'i tshe na yang gtsug lag @164a * //
translated: Later, when the site was prepared, the monks entered the absorption of mental concentration in the proper place.

original: khang byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the monastery was not yet built.

original: gsum pa la ni las kho nas so zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa'i dus gsum pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni las kho nas so zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa'i dus gsum pa ste /
translated: In the third case, it is by the rite itself.🔽At that time, the monks were not separated from the site.

original: gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i dus kyi de'i tshe na dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyis byin gyis brlab pa kho nar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i dus kyi de'i tshe na dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyis byin gyis brlab pa kho nar byas pa'o //
translated: At that time, the Saṅgha made the consecration by the rite of two requests.

original: dus gsum par byin gyis brlab pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni las kyi mtha' las byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum par byin gyis brlab pa'i rung ba'i khang pa 'di'i ming ni las kyi mtha' las byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The name of the proper place consecrated in the third case is “arisen from the rite.”

original: bzhi pa la ni ji snyed phyin pa de snyed kyis rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bsgrag pa'i tshig cig car brjod pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni ji snyed phyin pa de snyed kyis rung ba'i khang pa nyid du bsgrag pa'i tshig cig car brjod pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the fourth, by the simultaneous utterance of the words of proclamation in the very house that is suitable for as many monks as have come.

original: ji snyed phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma thob pa rnams la mang po nyid du 'jug par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ji snyed phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma thob pa rnams la mang po nyid du 'jug par 'gyur bas /
translated: As many as have come means that the word “many” is used for those who have not obtained the distinctions.

original: mnyam pa srid pa la byin gyis brlab par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam pa srid pa la byin gyis brlab par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are consecrated as equals.

original: bzhi pa la ni zhes bya ba ni dus la'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni zhes bya ba ni dus la'o //
translated: In the fourth means in time.

original: de ma yin pa la lhag par gnas pa'i phyir dge slong rnams phyin pa zhes bya ba de la'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa la lhag par gnas pa'i phyir dge slong rnams phyin pa zhes bya ba de la'o //
translated: Since it is not that, it is said that the monks have come.

original: cig car zhes bya ba la dge slong phyin pa thams cad kyis gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur ro zhes tshig mthun par cig car bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba la dge slong phyin pa thams cad kyis gzhi 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par 'gyur ro zhes tshig mthun par cig car bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Simultaneously means that all the monks who have come should simultaneously utter the words, “This place becomes a suitable house for the Saṅgha.” This is the meaning.

original: 'dir cho ga dang sngags ma brjod pa de bas na 'di ltar smos so //
analyzed: 'dir cho ga dang sngags ma brjod pa de bas na 'di ltar smos so //
translated: Since the rite and mantra are not mentioned here, it is stated like this.

original: 'di'i ming ni 'phral la byung ba'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming ni 'phral la byung ba'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “temporary dwelling.”

original: dus gzhan gyi tshe na dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba'i dus gsum pa 'di la las gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba de gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi tshe na dge slong gnas pa nyid dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba'i dus gsum pa 'di la las gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba de gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: At another time, the monk does not leave the dwelling. This is the third time. It should be understood that the dwelling is the same as before.

original: gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed ba la mi mdzes pa med pa zhes bya ba la gcig gis zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i khang pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gis gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed ba la mi mdzes pa med pa zhes bya ba la gcig gis zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i khang pa'o //
translated: “One” means a suitable house.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: ba lang gi gnas pa lta bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang gi gnas pa lta bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cow-pen dwelling?🔽It is dwelling in separate monasteries.

analyzed: gtsug lag khang tha dad pa na gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don de 'dis shes pa'o //
translated: This means that the meaning of “separate” is understood by this.

translated: That is a separate dwelling. In many separate places, in one suitable house, it is understood that the dwelling of many monasteries doing their duties is not improper.

analyzed: de ni tha dad par gyur pa'i rung ba nyid du ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni don gzhan 'dis dogs pa yin la 'brel bar gnas pa'i gzhi tha dad par gyur pa gang yin pa des so //
translated: By that which is a separate basis that remains connected,

analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par yang rung ba zhes bya ba gzhung 'dis smos pa de bas na de'i 'di bkag pa'o //

analyzed: 'dir ni de ma gsungs so zhes bya ba yang ci'i @164b phyir nges pa 'dir yin zhe na /
