analyzed: padma'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Lotus” is mentioned.

original: de yang nags kyi dus pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang nags kyi dus pa yin te /
translated: And that is the bone of the forest.

original: spangs te lags pas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: spangs te lags pas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be eaten after abandoning it.

original: 'dir thams cad du lhag ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas spangs te langs pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du lhag ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas spangs te langs pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, “after abandoning it” is connected with “having risen from all.”

original: padma zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is a lotus?

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste padma'i rtsa ba dang / padma'i rtsa lag dang be ta dang / autpa la'i rtsa ba dang padma'i snying po dag ni de zhes bya'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste padma'i rtsa ba dang / padma'i rtsa lag dang be ta dang / autpa la'i rtsa ba dang padma'i snying po dag ni de zhes bya'o zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “The root of a lotus, the stalk of a lotus, the root of a water lily, and the heart of a lotus are called a lotus.”

original: gzhir gtogs pa'i sman gyi gzhi'o /
analyzed: gzhir gtogs pa'i sman gyi gzhi'o /
translated: Medicinal roots are the basis of medicine.

original: // / de la re zhig 'brel pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de la re zhig 'brel pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, first of all, the connection should be stated.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa dag ni nad dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dag ni nad dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: Hunger and thirst are not like a disease.

original: de bas na de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa 'tsho ba tsam sgrub par byed pa bza' bar bya ba dang / btung bar bya ba dus su rung ba'i sman gyi chos khongs su gtogs pa nyid gang yin pa de dag gi 'du ba'i sgo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa 'tsho ba tsam sgrub par byed pa bza' bar bya ba dang / btung bar bya ba dus su rung ba'i sman gyi chos khongs su gtogs pa nyid gang yin pa de dag gi 'du ba'i sgo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the door of entry for those that are merely the means of subsistence that are the antidote to those, which are included in the Dharma of medicine that is suitable at the proper time to be eaten and drunk,

original: rgyal srid dang de'i phyed nod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te de'i zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid de'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid dang de'i phyed nod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te de'i zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid de'o //
translated: it says, “One should not accept a kingdom or half of one.” “ That” refers to a kingdom.

original: dge 'dun gyi ched du grong mnod pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ched du grong mnod pa'o //
translated: Accepting a village is for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: zhing yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mnod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhing yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mnod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The field is also like that.

original: zhing ni grong gi phyogs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir grong med pa'i phyir dgon pa dang / 'bad rtsol med pa'i gnas dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba lhag mas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing ni grong gi phyogs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir grong med pa'i phyir dgon pa dang / 'bad rtsol med pa'i gnas dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba lhag mas shes par bya'o //
translated: The field is a part of the village, because it is not a village. The rest is understood: the field is connected with a place that is not an effort.

original: de yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni zhing de'o //🔽de'i 'og shas mnod do //
analyzed: de yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni zhing de'o // de'i 'og shas mnod do //
translated: One should not abandon that field.🔽One should first take up the field.

original: thog shas brtsal lo //
analyzed: thog shas brtsal lo //
translated: One should first seek the field.

original: mnod pas de gtsug lag khang du dbul bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mnod pas de gtsug lag khang du dbul bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The field should be offered to the monastery.

original: nam gyi tshe gang zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe gang zhe na /
translated: When?

original: de'i phyir bdag @165b nyid kyi bas dang por ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag @165b nyid kyi bas dang por ro //
translated: Therefore, first of all, by oneself.

original: bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong dag bsko'o zhes bya ba ni thog shas mnod pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong dag bsko'o zhes bya ba ni thog shas mnod pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Monks should be appointed for protection.

original: 'du ba dang 'god pa dang gnyis ka las gang yang rung ba mi mngon pas rtsis gdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du ba dang 'god pa dang gnyis ka las gang yang rung ba mi mngon pas rtsis gdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not count the gathering, the distribution, or both, if they are not evident.

original: 'du ba dang 'god pa dang / 'du 'god gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du ba dang 'god pa dang / 'du 'god gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Either one” means either to be counted or to be placed.

original: 'di rnams las gzhan pa'i dag 'dun gyi gnas gcig las gdags par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams las gzhan pa'i dag 'dun gyi gnas gcig las gdags par mi bya ste /
translated: “In no other way” means that one should not be counted or placed in any other way.

original: der rtsis gdab par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der rtsis gdab par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “One should enter” means that one should engage in that activity.

original: gzhan la dran ba dang shes bzhin sngon du btang ste de la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽gzhan la zhes bya ba ni gang du gnyis ka gdags pa byed pa la der rtsis byed pa la dran pa dang / shes bzhin sngon du btang ste 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la dran ba dang shes bzhin sngon du btang ste de la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba la / gzhan la zhes bya ba ni gang du gnyis ka gdags pa byed pa la der rtsis byed pa la dran pa dang / shes bzhin sngon du btang ste 'jug par bya'o //
translated: “In the presence of others” means that one should enter that activity in the presence of others, having first aroused mindfulness and introspection.

original: dge 'dun gyi ched du g-yog 'khor nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni ma byin par len pa'i pham par gyur pa las 'dir las kyi mthar /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ched du g-yog 'khor nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni ma byin par len pa'i pham par gyur pa las 'dir las kyi mthar /
translated: “For the sake of the saṃgha” means that one should take on the role of attendant for the sake of the saṃgha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, the text reads: “In regard to the defeat that is taking what was not given, the Blessed One said:

original: dge 'dun gyi ched du g-yog blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ched du g-yog blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‘One should take on the role of attendant for the sake of the saṃgha.’”

original: gang nas gtsug lag khang du sgra mi 'byung ba der lha 'bangs kyi khyim byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: gang nas gtsug lag khang du sgra mi 'byung ba der lha 'bangs kyi khyim byed du gzhug go //
translated: In whatever place the sound of the scriptures is not heard, there the king should appoint a householder who is a devotee.

original: ji snyad dgos par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ji snyad dgos par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: He should be engaged in whatever is necessary.

original: zas dang gos sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas dang gos sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should give food and clothing.

original: gtso bor dge 'dun gyi g-yog dag la'o //
analyzed: gtso bor dge 'dun gyi g-yog dag la'o //
translated: This is primarily for the attendants of the Saṅgha.

original: gal te gzhan med na de'i don du sbyin pa shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan med na de'i don du sbyin pa shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: If there are none, it is understood by implication that he should give for their sake.

original: gal te las byed pa na'o zhes bya ba ni gal te g-yog dag las byas na de dag la zas dang gos sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te las byed pa na'o zhes bya ba ni gal te g-yog dag las byas na de dag la zas dang gos sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
translated: If he is working, he should give food and clothing to those who are working.

original: na ba rnams la g-yog bya'o zhes bya ba ni g-yog dag gal te nan de rnams la yal bar mi dor de sman la sogs pas bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: na ba rnams la g-yog bya'o zhes bya ba ni g-yog dag gal te nan de rnams la yal bar mi dor de sman la sogs pas bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sick. If the attendants are working, he should not neglect them. He should serve them with medicine and so on.

original: ba glang dang ma he dang ra dang lug dang / glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo dang bong bu dang / 'bru tsam pa dang snod kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun gyi ched du blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba glang dang ma he dang ra dang lug dang / glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo dang bong bu dang / 'bru tsam pa dang snod kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun gyi ched du blang bar bya'o //
translated: cows, buffaloes, goats, sheep, elephants, horses, camels, and donkeys, and also vessels, but only for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: gleng gzhi rnams las 'bru tsam ba gnang ba rjes su gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnams las 'bru tsam ba gnang ba rjes su gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Vinaya masters explain that the Buddha allowed the use of vessels the size of a grain of barley.

original: phran tshegs dag las ni snod rnams la'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las ni snod rnams la'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Kṣudraka Collection says that vessels are allowed.

original: 'di yang 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis longs spyod dang / longs spyod mchog blang du rung ngam ka ta ya na dge 'dun gyi ched du blang du rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis longs spyod dang / longs spyod mchog blang du rung ngam ka ta ya na dge 'dun gyi ched du blang du rung ngo //
translated: The text here is: Is it permissible for a monk to accept wealth and the best of wealth? It is permissible to accept it for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: de la longs spyod ni grong dang zhing dag go //
analyzed: de la longs spyod ni grong dang zhing dag go //
translated: Wealth refers to villages and fields.

original: longs spyod mchog ni ba lang dang ra dang lug dang ma he'o //
analyzed: longs spyod mchog ni ba lang dang ra dang lug dang ma he'o //
translated: The best of wealth refers to cows, goats, sheep, and buffaloes.
The text continues:🔽Is it permissible for a monk to accept a slave? It is permissible to accept him for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: byad ma yin pa dag gang zhe na glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo dang ba lang dang / bong bu dang ra dang lug dang ma he bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba mchod rten gyi yang rung ba dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byad ma yin pa dag gang zhe na glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo dang ba lang dang / bong bu dang ra dang lug dang ma he bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba mchod rten gyi yang rung ba dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One has permitted them for stupas.

original: ma mo las de bsdus nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mo las de bsdus nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the Mātṛkā as a summary.

original: gang zhig phul nas khyim pa shi na glang po che la sogs pa rnams rgyal po la dbul lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig phul nas khyim pa shi na glang po che la sogs pa rnams rgyal po la dbul lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: If a householder dies after giving them, the elephants and so on are to be given to the king.

original: rdzas 'di nyid rnyed pa la yang khyim pas rgyal po dbang ba nyid ces bya ba de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: rdzas 'di nyid rnyed pa la yang khyim pas rgyal po dbang ba nyid ces bya ba de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin gyi /
translated: The intention of the statement that these substances belong to the king if they are found is this.

original: de bdag tu byed pa la mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba rten rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bdag tu byed pa la mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba rten rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not suitable for them to be owned by him.

original: de dag mchod rten gyir yang mi rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag mchod rten gyir yang mi rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not unsuitable for stupas.

original: grong la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi ched du blang du rung ba de dag mchod rten gyi ched du yang rung /
analyzed: grong la sogs pa dge 'dun gyi ched du blang du rung ba de dag mchod rten gyi ched du yang rung /
translated: Those villages, etc. which are suitable for the Sangha are also suitable for the caitya.🔽Those which are suitable for the Sangha are also suitable for the individual.

original: dge 'dun gyi ched du yang rung ba de dag go zhes bya ba ma mor gtogs pa de bas na mdo 'di'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ched du yang rung ba de dag go zhes bya ba ma mor gtogs pa de bas na mdo 'di'o //
translated: Thus, this is the sutra.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'dir lhag ma bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'dir lhag ma bsdus pa'o //
translated: Following that, the remainder is collected here.🔽One should keep a toothpick and a water-pot.

original: kha gzar dang tshva khug bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de gnyis zhes bya ba ni kha gzar dang tshva khug dag go //
analyzed: kha gzar dang tshva khug bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de gnyis zhes bya ba ni kha gzar dang tshva khug dag go //
translated: Those two means the toothpick and the water-pot.

original: de gnyis dang phul ba'i btung phor las gzhan ba'i khar ba'i snod gang zag gis bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis dang phul ba'i btung phor las gzhan ba'i khar ba'i snod gang zag gis bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not keep any other drinking vessel except those two and the offered drinking cup.

original: kun dga' ra ba pa nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should appoint a caretaker.

original: 'dir ma mo las dge 'dun gang gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ma mo las dge 'dun gang gis kyang ngo //
translated: Here, the Sangha should appoint a caretaker.🔽For the sake of protection, one should accept those who offer themselves as caretakers.

original: bsrung ba'i phyir byis pa mtshan mthun pa 'bul ba dag blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun nam gang zag gis kyang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i phyir byis pa mtshan mthun pa 'bul ba dag blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun nam gang zag gis kyang blang bar bya'o //
translated: This means that the Sangha or an individual should accept them.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'phrog ma skyabs su song zhing bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'phrog ma skyabs su song zhing bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bzhag nas /
translated: When the Licchavi people saw that the Blessed One had gone for refuge and placed him in the bases of training,

original: des bu de dag gnod sbyin gdug pas 'jigs pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge 'dun la phul ba thos nas /
analyzed: des bu de dag gnod sbyin gdug pas 'jigs pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge 'dun la phul ba thos nas /
translated: they heard that he had offered his sons to the Saṅgha in order to protect them from the fear of the fierce yakṣas.

original: de dag 'di snyam du des bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong rnams la bu re zhig 'bul bar byed na bdag cag gis kyang ci'i phyir mi dbul snyam nas /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du des bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong rnams la bu re zhig 'bul bar byed na bdag cag gis kyang ci'i phyir mi dbul snyam nas /
translated: They thought, “If he offers his sons to the monks in order to protect them, why shouldn’t we also offer them?”

original: de dag gis bu dbul bar brtsams pa dang / dge slong dag mi len nas /
analyzed: de dag gis bu dbul bar brtsams pa dang / dge slong dag mi len nas /
translated: They began to offer their sons, but the monks did not accept them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Accept them.”

original: 'dir tshul ni rjes su 'gro ba ni dge 'dun gyis blangs te /
analyzed: 'dir tshul ni rjes su 'gro ba ni dge 'dun gyis blangs te /
translated: Here is the rule: The Saṅgha accepts them

original: kun dga' ra ba'i g-yog tu rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i g-yog tu rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: and they live as servants in the monastery.

original: de lta bas na bye brag med par brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bye brag med par brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are supported without distinction.

original: de dag gi cha lugs ni mgul par chos gos btags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi cha lugs ni mgul par chos gos btags pa nyid do //
translated: Their dress is just the upper robe worn around the neck.

original: @166b skyed par yang rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @166b skyed par yang rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also proper to raise them.

original: de dag gi cha lugs ni mgul par chos gos kyi tshal bu re re btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi cha lugs ni mgul par chos gos kyi tshal bu re re btags pa yin no //
translated: Their dress is that they wear a single piece of Dharma robe around their neck.

original: phan gdags pa'i sems kyis so sor bskyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i sems kyis so sor bskyang bar bya'o //
translated: They should be cared for individually with a helpful attitude.

original: de'i nye dus phul ba blang par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nye dus phul ba blang par bya'o //
translated: One should accept what is offered by their relatives.

original: mjug tu rin nyid du yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mjug tu rin nyid du yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the end, even a price.

original: de'i nye du dag gis mjug tu byis pa phyir len pa'i tshe de'i dus phul ba blang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i nye du dag gis mjug tu byis pa phyir len pa'i tshe de'i dus phul ba blang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should accept what is offered by their relatives in the end when the child is returned.

original: de ltar yang de rnams kyis phul bar gyur pa la dad pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin pas 'di la log pas 'tsho ba nyid yin par dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang de rnams kyis phul bar gyur pa la dad pa'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin pas 'di la log pas 'tsho ba nyid yin par dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: Since it is done out of faith in what is offered by them, one should not suspect that this is a wrong livelihood.

original: de bas na de la 'di bstan pa'o //🔽de dag gis byas pa shes pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de bas na de la 'di bstan pa'o // de dag gis byas pa shes pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Therefore, this is taught for them.🔽Also, by knowing what they have done.

original: byis pa de dag gis byas pa shes pas phul ba yang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa de dag gis byas pa shes pas phul ba yang blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should accept what is offered by those children who know what they have done.

original: de'i rin gdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rin gdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not accept a price for it.

original: dge slong gis byis pa de dag yongs su bskyangs pa'i rin dang rngan pa blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis byis pa de dag yongs su bskyangs pa'i rin dang rngan pa blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk should not accept a price or a gift for nurturing those children.

original: shing thog gi rnyed pa bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shing thog gi rnyed pa bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should take possession of the fruit.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las te ;
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las te ;
translated: Here the text is from the Vibhāṣā:

original: 'og ma gsum gyis yang ngo //
analyzed: 'og ma gsum gyis yang ngo //
translated: The three below are also.

original: 'dir sil bu dag las /
analyzed: 'dir sil bu dag las /
translated: Here, from the loose fruits,

original: bza' bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: one should not eat them.

original: zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi lbu ba'i bum pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi lbu ba'i bum pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also a pot of clarified butter, oil, honey, and molasses.

original: zhun mar la sogs pas gang ba'i bum pa ni blang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhun mar la sogs pas gang ba'i bum pa ni blang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: A pot filled with clarified butter, etc. should be accepted.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here the text is:

original: zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi /
analyzed: zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi /
translated: Clarified butter, oil, honey, and molasses

original: lbu ba'i bum pa dge 'dun la phul na bum pa'i tshad tsam po de rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lbu ba'i bum pa dge 'dun la phul na bum pa'i tshad tsam po de rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: if a pot of these is offered to the Saṅgha, those pots the size of a certain measure, and so on,🔽up to

original: ji srid bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji srid bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blang bar bya zhing blangs pas dge slong dag gam khyim bdag gis brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: blang bar bya zhing blangs pas dge slong dag gam khyim bdag gis brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “You should accept it and, having accepted it, the monks or the laypeople should distribute it.”

original: dge 'dun du gtogs pa'i tshig ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun du gtogs pa'i tshig ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “belongs to the Saṅgha”:

original: 'dir dge 'dun nam gang zag gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad la ma byas te /
analyzed: 'dir dge 'dun nam gang zag gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad la ma byas te /
translated: Here, it is not the Saṅgha or an individual that is meant.

original: 'di ni gang zag la mi rigs pa'i ngo bo ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag la mi rigs pa'i ngo bo ma mthong ngo //
translated: But the nature of an individual is not seen to be inappropriate.

original: de bas na skabs kyi dbang gis tshig 'dir blangs so snyam du rnam par nges nas bye brag tu ma smos so //🔽de dag gi snod kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽zhun mar la sogs pa de dag gi snod de bum pa ni bum pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na skabs kyi dbang gis tshig 'dir blangs so snyam du rnam par nges nas bye brag tu ma smos so // de dag gi snod kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni / zhun mar la sogs pa de dag gi snod de bum pa ni bum pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is determined that the word “it” refers to the context, and it is not specified.🔽“Their containers”🔽means the containers for the ghee, etc., which are the pots.

original: de dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhun mar la sogs pa'i snod bum pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhun mar la sogs pa'i snod bum pa dag go //
translated: “They should be placed” means the pots for the ghee, etc.

original: zhun mar la sogs pas gang ba'i bum pa zhes bya ba 'dir shugs kyis zhun mar gyi bum pa la @167a * //
analyzed: zhun mar la sogs pas gang ba'i bum pa zhes bya ba 'dir shugs kyis zhun mar gyi bum pa la @167a * //
translated: The statement “a pot filled with oil, etc.” implies a pot of oil.

original: sogs pa'i don shes pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i don shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of a pot filled with ghee, etc. is understood by implication to be a pot of ghee, etc.

original: gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: Where should it be placed?

original: de'i phyir gzhi la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said on the ground.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba dang chang gi bum pa dag ni mi mkho ba nyid do //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba dang chang gi bum pa dag ni mi mkho ba nyid do //
translated: The pots for excrement, urine, and beer are not needed.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir yang g-yos dang 'tshed pa gang yin pa dag gi zhal ta bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽byed du 'jug pa zhal ta byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir yang g-yos dang 'tshed pa gang yin pa dag gi zhal ta bya'o zhes bya ba ni / byed du 'jug pa zhal ta byed pa ste /
translated: One should attend to the cooking and boiling that is for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: rang gis bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gis bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Attending to means causing to be done, not doing it oneself.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sman gyi gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sman gyi gzhi las /
translated: Here, the text from the chapter on medicine

original: 'dir dang por byas nas lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir dang por byas nas lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs so //
translated: up to having first done this, one should keep the bowl cover is stated.

original: lhung bzed du bsod snyoms ma blugs pa'i mdun rol du ma bzung ba nyid kyis bsod snyoms la 'jug par bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhung bzed du bsod snyoms ma blugs pa'i mdun rol du ma bzung ba nyid kyis bsod snyoms la 'jug par bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not begin to eat almsfood without first holding the bowl in front of oneself, before the almsfood has been poured into it.

original: ma blugs pa'i mdun rol du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma blugs pa'i mdun rol du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Before the almsfood has been poured into it” means

original: mdun rol du lhung bzed blos ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdun rol du lhung bzed blos ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: before the bowl has been held in front of oneself.

original: lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “One should use a bowl-lid” means

original: lhung bzed kyi nang du bsod snyoms blugs pa gang gis g-yogs par byed pa de ni lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi nang du bsod snyoms blugs pa gang gis g-yogs par byed pa de ni lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs zhes bya'o //
translated: a bowl-lid is that with which one covers the bowl while eating almsfood.

original: 'di dang 'khar ba'i snod bcang ba la thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dang 'khar ba'i snod bcang ba la thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not doubt that this is not the same as the carrying-case for the begging-bowl” means
